characters: REVEALING A BANK MANAGER SEATED AT A DESK. WE HEAR GINGER
AT THE BOOTH WITH LESTER AND GINGER.
CAMERA SPIRALS OUT FROM THE BODIES OF A CASINO EXECUTIVE
IN SLOW MOTION CAMERA MOVES IN ON ACE AND GINGER, STANDIN
INT. GYM/BOOKIE JOINT, SEVERAL DAYS LATER
WALL AND A WOODEN CIGAR STORE INDIAN STATUE, TO REVEAL
WE MOVE PAST THE SKULL OF A STEER MOUNTED ON AN EXTERIOR
MICROPHONE AND TRANSMITTER AT ITS BASE.
HIS WIFE WHO HAVE BEEN GUNNED DOWN ON THEIR FRONT LAWN.
THE FBI AGENT LOOKING OUT THE WINDOW TALKING
OVERHEAD DOLLY IN ON SIGNALER WHO APPEARS TO BE NERVOUSLY
THE CAMERA FOLLOWS NICKY AROUND THE RESTAURANT PAST LAS V
THE SIGNALER IS SLUMPED DOWN IN HIS SEAT, TOSSING DOWN SO
SPYING ON PLAYERS BELOW WITH BINOCULARS.
WE MOVE PAST TWO TELEVISION CAMERAS TO ACE BEHIND HIS DES
OVERHEAD VIEW OF THE SIGNALER'S TABLE. VARIOUS SECURITY G
BRIDE AND GROOM FIGURINES ON THE CAKE.
OF TV SECURITY MONITORS ON THE PARKING AREA IN FRONT AND
CAMERA PULLS AWAY FROM THE DOOR LEADING TO THE VIEWING RO
AND THE POST OFFICE ACROSS THE STREET.
AND MARINO WHO ARE WAITING INSIDE THE GOLD RUSH. CAMERA C
THE CARD, PAST A PIT BOS
NOW BEING TRANSCRIBED BY AN FBI STENOGRAPHER
ACE ENTERING, FOLLOWED BY A HOOD. HE SITS DO
SHERBERT AND OTHER GUESTS LOOK ON.
NEXT TO A LARGE WEDDING CAKE. THEY ARE KISSING. NICKY,
A ROOM AND BALCONY WITH DRAWN
CARDS AND SNEAKING LOOKS AT THE DEALER'S HAND AT THE WINN
IT IS SUCKED UP INTO A STRAW.
CHEST. COPS AND PRESS ARE MILLING AROUND.
SLOWLY BEGIN TO GATHER AROUND IT.
THE CAMERA MOVES PAST NICKY TO REVEAL MARINO, SEATED IN F
INSIDE A GLASS DOME HANGING FROM THE CEILING.
AT ANOTHER TAPING OF HIS SHOW. TRUDY IS AT HIS SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM 'ACE' ROTHSTEIN, a tall, lean, immaculately dressed m approaches his car, opens the door, and gets inside to tu on the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you love someone, you've gotta  trust them. There's no other way.  You've got to give them the key to  everything that's yours.  Otherwise,  what's the point? And, for a while...  I believed that's the kind of love I  had. Suddenly, the car explodes. Flames, smoke and metal rise  into the sky covering the view of the Las Vegas casinos a their signs. Music in: J.S. Bach - 'St Matthew Passion'. Ace's body comes flying in - extreme slow motion. His bod twists and turns through the frame like a soul about to t into the flames of damnation. MAIN TITLE SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vignette of ACE through rippling flames, we move in on AC ROTHSTEIN overseeing the casino. He lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I ever ran a casino or got  myself blown up, Ace Rothstein was a  hell of a handicapper, I can tell  you that. I was so good, that whenever  I bet, I could change the odds for  every bookmaker in the country. I'm  serious. I had it down so cold that  I was given paradise on earth. I was  given one of the biggest casinos in  Las Vegas to run, the Tangiers...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Vignette of MOB BOSSES sitting at a table surrounded by f and wine like the gods of Olympus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...by the only kind of guys that can  actually get you that kind of money:  sixty-two million, seven-hundred  thousand dollars. I don't know all  the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter of fact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vignette of NICKY SANTORO standing at a bar with DOMINICK SANTORO, his brother, and FRANK MARINO, his right-hand ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nobody knew all the details, but  it should'a been perfect. I mean, he  had me, Nicky Santoro, his best  friend, watching his ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vignette of GINGER MCKENNA a dazzling thirty-one-year-old blonde seated by a small fiery pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he had Ginger, the woman he  loved, on his arm.  But in the end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE looks over the casino he rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we fucked it all up. It should'a  been so sweet, too.  But it turned  out to be the last time that street  guys like us were ever given anything  that fuckin' valuable again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerial shot coming down out of the clouds over the bright lit Vegas Strip and off into the blackness of the desert  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that time, Vegas was a place where  millions of suckers flew in every  year on their own nickel, and left  behind about a billion dollars. But  at night, you couldn't see the desert  that surrounds Las Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerial shot swooping along the desert floor, then rising  above the mist to reveal mountains in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's in the desert where lots of  the town's problems are solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a lot of holes in the desert,  and a lot of problems are buried in  those holes. Except you gotta do it  right. I mean, you gotta have the  hole already dug before you show up  with a package in the trunk.   Otherwise you're talkin' about a  half-hour or forty-five minutes of  diggin'. And who knows who's gonna  be comin' along in that time? Before  you know it, you gotta dig a few  more holes. You could be there all  fuckin' night.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE IN
dialogues.text: ACE is greeted by a casino exec and walked through the  brightly lit entrance to the Tangiers Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could resist? Anywhere else in  the country, I was a bookie, a  gambler, always lookin' over my  shoulder, hassled by cops, day and  night. But here, I'm 'Mr Sam  Rothstein'. I'm not only legitimate,  but running a casino. And that's  like selling dreams for cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see ACE enter alone. He is greeted by BILLY SHERBERT.  They are joined by top executives RICHIE and RONNIE in su and ties. They walk through the casino, past crowded and  noisy craps tables, spinning roulette wheels, blackjack  tables, poker-faced players at poker tables, and elegant, cordoned-off, black-tie, baccarat tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hired an old casino pal, Billy  Sherbert, as my manager and I went  to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Introducing the EXECS  to ACE) ...And this is Ronnie, who takes  care of the card room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For guys like me, Las Vegas washes  away your sins. It's a morality car  wash. It does for us what Lourdes  does for humpbacks and cripples.  And, along with making us legit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly back from a wall of money. An employee pours a buck full of coins into a trough. Camera follows progress as  numerous coins move on a conveyor system, through a sorti machine. Camera reveals several rolls of coins on a lower conveyor as they move up a ladder towards an employee's h who then places the rolls on a rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...comes cash. Tons of it. I mean,  what do you think we're doing out  here in the middle of the desert?   It's all this money. This is the end  result of all the bright lights and  the comped trips, of all the champagne  and free hotel suites, and all the  broads and all the booze. It's all  been arranged just for us to get  your money. That's the truth about  Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera follows JOHN NANCE carrying a small suitcase and  walking through the casino to a door leading to the cashi cage. The sign on the door reads 'Authorized Personnel On He walks through the cage, to another door: 'Notice - Kee Out'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the only winners. The players  don't stand a chance. And their cash  flows from the tables to our boxes  ...through the cage and into the  most sacred room in the casino ...the  place where they add up all the money  ...the holy of holies ...the count  room. He opens the door. We see inside the count room from NANC point of view. It looks like the area behind a teller's cage in a bank. large room, windowless, decor-free. One side is a mesh ca opened to reveal stacks of cash boxes. Several COUNTERS i white shirts are gathered around a glass table counting a sorting paper money.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this place was off limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verify two thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even I couldn't get inside, but it  was my job to keep it filled with  cash. That's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had so much fuckin' money in  there, you could build a house out  of stacks of $100 bills. And the  best part was that upstairs, the  board of directors didn't know what  the fuck was going on. At one end of the room the clerks empty the metal boxes a rapidly count the cash at a counting table. The camera fo a cash 'drop box' being lifted from the stack by a clerk. pours the cash on to the table and shows the empty box to video camera. COUNTER #2 rapidly counts the cash and  announces:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, to them everything looked on  the up and up. Right? Wrong. The first counter recounts the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verify five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys inside the counting room... Stacks of bills lie nearby. The camera pans across the ro to another table manned by a COUNT ROOM EXECUTIVE who rep the figure and writes it down on a master list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand. We move back to NANCE opening a cabinet full of stacks of $100 bills. He opens his suitcase and begins to fill it w cash. As he does this, the workers studiously look in oth directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...were all slipped in there to skim  the joint dry.  They'd do short  counts, they'd lose fill slips. They'd  even take cash right out of the drop  boxes. And it was up to this guy  right here [NANCE], standin' in front  of about two million dollars, to  skim the cash off the top without  anybody gettin' wise ...the IRS or  anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verify two hundred. NANCE closes the case and walks out. One of the counters  dumps another container of money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, notice how in the count room  nobody ever seems to see anything.  Somehow, somebody's always lookin'  the other way. Now, look at these  guys [COUNTERS]. They look busy,  right?  They're countin' money. Who  wants to bother them? I mean, God  forbid they should make a mistake  and forget to steal. Meanwhile, you're  in and you're out. NANCE exits the count room and proceeds through the lobby the casino, passing ACE and SHERBERT, to a side exit door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past the jag-off guard who gets an  extra c-note a week just to watch  the door.  I mean, it's routine.  Business as usual: in, out, hello,  goodbye. And that's all there is to  it. Just another fat fuck walkin'  out of the casino with a suitcase.  Now, that suitcase was goin' straight  to one place: right to Kansas City  ...which was as close to Las Vegas  as the Midwest bosses could go without  gettin' themselves arrested. NANCE leaves the casino and gets into a cab parked at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE arrives. He is greeted by ARTIE PISCANO, a gray-hai sixty-year-old underboss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That suitcase was all the bosses  ever wanted ...and they wanted it  every month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, John, how are you? How was your  ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE, with suitcase, and PISCANO leave the car and enter the produce market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this old Mormon fuck here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE and PISCANO walk through the grocery store, through the warehouse, past various employees to a doorway leadin into the back room, where they are greeted by five older around a large wooden table with bowls of macaroni and ol jelly glasses filled with red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he had to fly in with suitcases  once a month, nice and easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' smells good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they made us somethin' to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bosses would come from all over  the place: Detroit, Cleveland,  Milwaukee. All over the Midwest.   And they would meet in the back of  this produce market in Kansas City.  I mean, nobody even knew. NANCE shakes hands with AMERICO CAPELLI, sixty-eight, a b affable Milwaukee entrepreneur and ARTHUR CAPP, his thirt year-old yuppie lawyer son. Camera continues to pan around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the guys made his mother do  all the cooking. On VINCENT BORELLI, seventy-year-old Kansas City boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see that guy Jerry  Steriano? On VINNIE FORLANO, mid-seventies, an old-timer who once d for Capone and is now Remo Gaggi's right-hand man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry Steriano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, these old greaseballs might not  look it, but believe me, these are  the guys who secretly controlled Las  Vegas. PISCANO joins his MOTHER and DAUGHTER by a stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man's here again. Piscano dips a piece of bread into a pot of tomato sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they controlled the Teamsters'  Union, and that's where you had to  go if you wanted to borrow money to  buy a casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you've finished with him, I  want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Carrying a plate of  food to the table  where BORELLI and  FORLANO are seated.) Here you are, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody got a Teamsters' loan,  unless the guys in this room knew  they were gonna get their little  suitcases. FORLANO gets up from the table and walks toward NANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys like this antique here [FORLANO],  out of Detroit. Or especially guys  like Remo Gaggi, the outfit's top  boss. NANCE embraces REMO GAGGI who's seated on a couch, and si across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a round figure on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely the most important guy in  this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Picking up the  suitcase) About twenty pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's around seven hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh, good. NANCE opens the case to reveal the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off-screen, from  following scene) I know it's a little early for Las  Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Camera tilts down a model of the Tangiers Hotel and Casin then reveals the cover of Business Week magazine with a  drawing of PHILIP GREEN, a young corporate type, smiling under the headline: 'Philip Green, Vegas Wunderkind'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I do want to welcome the ladies  and gentlemen of the gaming industry. On ANDY STONE, a middle-aged man at a podium giving a spe while GREEN, seated at a table, looks on. PHOTOGRAPHERS f their cameras. ACE and SHERBERT, sitting next to GREEN, a watch the photo op ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the world was concerned  Andy Stone, the head of the Teamsters'  Pension Fund, was a legitimate guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a very auspicious occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A powerful man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip, if you would rise. Green stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He even played golf with the  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of the Teamsters' Pension  Fund, it is my pleasure to present  to you . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Andy also took orders. And when  he was told to give a pension fund  loan to Philip Green...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Handing GREEN a large  cardboard facsimile  'check') ...this check for $62,700,000 for  the new Tangiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he did what he was told. PHILIP GREEN, who is now the head of the Tangiers Hotel a Casino Corporation, is standing at the podium giving a sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now here was the perfect front man.  I mean, what the fuck else could he  be?  He didn't know too much. He  didn't want to know too much,  especially that the bosses made the  Teamsters lend him the money. He  wanted to believe the Teamsters gave  him all that fuckin' money 'cause he  was smart. An exploding flash bulb fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I say that, knowing full well  just how much competition we have in  this great city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a MAN and a WOMAN swimming underwater. Camera reve that they are in a motel swimming pool with glass porthol Expensive cars are parked outside one of the rooms. Hoods stand around outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where they got Green from - who  the fuck knows?  All I know is that  Green was an Arizona real estate  hustler, who barely had enough gas  money to come and pick up his own  fuckin' check...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: We return to the press conference. Photographers snap awa In the background are six-foot blow-ups of the Business W cover. The camera moves past GREEN, CAPP and several othe men, past SHERBERT, to ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, all they needed was somebody  they could trust to run the casino.  And who better than Ace?  I mean, he  was already in Vegas a couple of  years and he had the fuckin' place  clocked. FREEZE FRAME ON ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera looks straight down from the top of a hotel to a l pool area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But typical Ace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STONE, in a bathing suit and robe, sits on a lounge chair with a telephone. ACE, in sports clothes, sits on another chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...give him a shot at runnin' a casino  and he tries to talk you out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't know if I could do  this even if I wanted to. The Gaming  Commission would never give me a  license. I have at least two dozen  gambling and bookmaking pinches on  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to have a license to  work in a casino. All you gotta do  is apply for one. The state law says  you can work in a casino while they're  processing your application. They  got a ten-year backlog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what happens when they do find  out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they want to find out?  We're puttin' a hundred million into  this desert here. Why would they  want to lock us out?  And besides,  they'll never find out. All you gotta  do is keep changing your job title.  Like, uh, from Casino Executive to  Food and Beverage Chairman. And what  happens it, they take your  application, they put it at the bottom  of the pile. I know guys workin'  there for thirty years, don't have a  license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Exhales) It's a tough proposition, Andy. You,  you know, if I did it, I'd have to  run it my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. No interference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's gonna interfere with your  running the casino. I guarantee it. Stone lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE blows on a die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's how that got Ace to take  over. ACES's hands place the die into a micrometer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted him because Ace ate,  slept and breathed gambling. Camera swish tilts up to ACE, then swish pans to boxman,  dealers and players watching him, trying to act calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They worked out a real cute job title  too. We see the die in the micrometer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tangiers Public Relations Director. Satisfied the die is not loaded ACE sets it on the craps  table, the camera cranes up to reveal the Tangiers Casino floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the only thing he ever directed  was the casino. He made his first  bet when he was fifteen years old,  and he always made money. But he  didn't bet like you or me. A DEALER is sliding chips, tossing them on to a craps tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, havin' some fun with it,  shit like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Approaching the DEALER) Where the hell did you learn how to  deal? (He reaches down,  stacking and arranging  the chips.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bet like a fuckin' brain surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the chastised

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Place the checks properly. That's  the way you do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to know everything, this guy. Direct overhead tracking shot as ACE walks between two ro of gaming tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd find out the kind of inside  stuff nobody else knew, and that's  what he'd put his money on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE walks past two boxers sparring in a ring, through a  doorway into a room where several gamblers are seated aro a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even back home, years ago, when we  were first hangin' out together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he'd know if the quarterback was  on coke. ACE is looking at the odds board for college football gam The bookie, LUCKY LARRY, is waiting for ACE to hand in hi picks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take Columbia for twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If his girlfriend was knocked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dimes on Columbia . . . As soon as ACE bets, a man erases a number from the chalk and replaces it was a '6', changing the odds. Two GAMBLER saunter from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd get the wind velocity so he  could judge the field goals. He even  figured out the different bounce you  got off the different kinds of wood  they used on college basketball  courts, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two GAMBLERS we saw sauntering out of the bookie join are racing to the nearest public phones. Another GAMBLER already beaten them to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd be workin' on this shit day and  night. There was nothin' about a  game he was gonna bet that he didn't  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into phone) Ace got down at six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into phone) Charlie, hey. Rothstein got six.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GYM/BOOKIE JOINT, SEVERAL DAYS LATER
dialogues.text: A bookie hands a stack of money to another bookie, who ha the money to ACE. ACE removes several bills from the top of the stack of  winnings and holds them out to the BOOKIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Season after season, the prick was  the only guaranteed winner I ever  knew. But he was so serious about it  all that I don't think he ever enjoyed  himself.  But... ACE exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that's just the way he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has an espresso machine and a saint's day calend Assorted hoods are listening to NICKY at the bar. Camera  dollies to REMO GAGGI, at the rear table playing gin rumm with OLD MAN CAPO and losing. Every time the CAPO picks u card, he's able to knock or get gin, sending GAGGI into a fit bemoaning his bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But back then the bosses didn't give  a fuck about whether he enjoyed  himself of not. To them, he was a  cash register. All they had to do  was ring the bell and take the money.  Especially Remo, who was a fuckin'  degenerate gambler who always lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Slams down his cards  and curses at his  losing hands) Ma che cazzo! [Italian-American slang for 'What a prick.'] All those fu sweeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, unless Ace made his bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't contest the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Va fa 'n culo! [Italian-American  slang for 'Fuck off']  (Summoning a young  man.) Johnny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace made more money for them on a  weekend than I could do heisting  joints for a month. ACE enters and walks to GAGGI's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever Ace picked up on the street  he told Remo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walks over to ACE  and whispers) Hey, did you bring that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I mean fixed fights, doped  horses, crooked fuckin' zebras...  locked-in point spreads. He told  fuckin' Remo everything. And to tell  you the truth. I don't blame him. GAGGI stands up and shakes ACE's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keepin' Remo happy with money was  the greatest insurance policy in the  world. GAGGI beams as ACE takes out an envelope filled with cash and hands it over to him. GAGGI sits back down and ACE,  knowing his place, smiles and is about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch. How the hell did you  get Oklahoma-Michigan?  Nobody ever  had Oklahoma-Mi... How the hell'd  you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's why they paid so well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? (Chuckles.) Never tells me nothin'. Ace, what do  we got on for next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a little too early. I'd  say Thursday would be good. I'll  know by then. Is that all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You come by the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven o'clock. GAGGI gets up and kisses ACE as NICKY and OLD MAN CAPO lo on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, my boy. Keep it up. Okay,  Ace? ACE nods in agreement and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY) Hey, Nick. Vien acca. [Italian- American slang for 'Come here']

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) I'll be right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T'aggia parla. [Italian-American  slang for 'I've got to talk to you']  Nicky... See that guy? (pointing to the off- screen ACE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep a good eye on him. He's makin'  a lot of money for us. And he's gonna  continue makin' a lot of money for  us, so keep a good eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like your fuckin' friends out  there, that... without brains.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Mi raccomando. [Italian- American slang for 'I'm counting on  you']

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reaching down to  touch GAGGI's money,  joking with him.) Want me to take this for you? (He walks out.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, now, on top of everything else,  I gotta make sure that nobody fucks  around with the Golden Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move past JOE, a guy at the bar entertaining a BRUNETT and a BLONDE, to NICKY and FRANK MARINO at the other end. There are other bar patrons in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the BARTENDER) Chase, couple of shooters for the  ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we made a great pair. I made  book and Nicky made sure we always  collected. The old men loved us. And  why not? They all made money with  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) They payin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did Nicky collect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pay every week, like they're  supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where the fuck is the money? I  don't see the money. ACE enters, and greets the two girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Melissa. Heidi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the GIRLS) Who's this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY) Get the fuck out of here. It was  nine. I laid nine. ACE approaches NICKY and MARINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was eight.  Ace... tell him the  line on the Bear's game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he don't know, nobody knows. Told  you it was eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how come I laid nine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you're a jag-off. I would  have fuckin' made you lay ten... ACE notices a pen lying on the bar. He taps JOE on the  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To JOE) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (He holds up the pen) Is this yours? Your pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's my pen. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ju- Well, it's a nice pen. I just  didn't know whose it was. I thought  it was yours. I didn't want it to  get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. Why don't you take  that fuckin' pen and shove it up you  ass, you fuckin' jag-off? NICKY looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was just offering you the- NICKY moves towards JOE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Turning his back to  talk to the girls,  referring to ACE) This fuckin' asshole. NICKY grabs the pen out of ACE's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To JOE) Look out! Before ACE can react, NICKY grabs JOE and starts stabbing him in the neck with the pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe! Look out, Joe! Look out! NICKY grunts while JOE gasps and groans. The BLONDE screa while NICKY's hand continues to plunge the pen into JOE's throat. JOE tumbles to the floor. NICKY pounces on him, still stabbing and now kicking. JOE whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? You hear? You hear a  little girl, Frankie? You hear a  little girl, Ace? Is that a little  fuckin' girl?!  What happened to the  fuckin' tough guy?  Told my friend  stick it up his fuckin' ass?! Huh?!  Huh?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over whimpers and  pants) Wait a sec, Nicky, Nicky, Nicky. Ta- take it easy. ACE looks stunned. NICKY's still holding the bloody pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I was tryin' to figure out why  the guy was sayin' what he was sayin',  Nicky just hit him. No matter how  big a guy might be, Nicky would take  him on. You beat Nicky with fists,  he comes back with a bat. You beat  him with a knife, he comes back with  a gun. And you beat him with a gun,  you better kill him, because he'll  keep comin' back and back until one  of you is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera swoops from a woman cheering as she wins at a slot machine to a blackjack table, then to a roulette table an over to a craps table. Montage of very short cuts of chips being picked up, dice thrown, money being poured from a bucket, stacks of money

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with me protecting Ace, he made a  fortune for the bosses. I mean that's  what got him to Vegas. He was a money  machine. A tremendous earner for  these guys.  As soon as he took over,  he doubled the fuckin' drop. With  Ace the casino never saw so much  money. And the bosses, they couldn't  be happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera moves in on ACE as he looks out over the casino.  Dealers deftly stack chips, scoop up losses and pay off  winners. Chips and money are everywhere. In extreme close-up slow motion a die falls on to a table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and SHERBERT are walking down a casino aisle by the s machines. Dealers immediately snap to attention at their  approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Vegas, I had to keep a few juiced- in local cowboys working. They were  close to the, you know, good old  boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SHERBERT) Pay him six hundred a week, tell him  to walk around and look smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, without us, these guys, they'd  still be shovellin' mule shit. ACE points at paper cups, empty glasses and the debris of silver dollar wrappings on the floor. DON WARD, the Slots Manager in Western garb, immediately starts picking up th debris. ACE looks at WARD sternly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward, you gotta keep a cleaner  station. If you need 'Mr Clean',  page him, all right? WARD bends down and picks up some trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't happen again, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SHERBERT) Is this guy just another dumb fuckin'  white man, or what? What's his story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't get rid of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's juiced in. He's the County  Commissioner's cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't give the bum a mop job. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A card shoe slides across the baccarat table. A state SEN a little drunk, tips the dealer, kisses the blonder HOOKE with him, fills his pockets with his winnings and walks o to see ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These yokels ran the state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They passed the laws, they owned the  courts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Senator. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) Hey, I need a room. Need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see ya. (To SHERBERT) William would you... The SENATOR shakes hands with SHERBERT as the HOOKER join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had dozens of politicians and state  officials comin' through that place  every week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SHERBERT) Help the Senator, give him whatever  he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. (Leads the way.) Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not make them happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have some nice penthouses you'll  enjoy. Maybe the Presidential Suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SENATOR unzips the HOOKER's dress, kisses her and wal through the bedroom doorway, looking over his shoulder to her as she takes off her dress and walks out of his sight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For politicians...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE smoking a cigarette by the baccarat tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...like our state senator up there,  everything was on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SENATOR opens a bureau drawer and takes out a small v pouch and pours black $100 into his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys won their comped life  when they got elected. So, hey, why  not take advantage of it? Still, the  politicians come cheap. We could  handle them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K. K. ICHIKAWA a Japanese businessman, and a male associa pick up towels and soap from about the bedroom of their s A blonde woman checks herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a whale like K. K. Ichikawa,  who plays thirty thousand dollars a  hand in baccarat. That's the one you  really gotta watch. ICHIKAWA and his associate walk into the the suite's livi room and join a Japanese woman seated on a couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays fast and big and he has the  cash and the credit to turn out your  lights. About a year ago, he cleaned  out a couple of casinos in the Cayman  Islands. They begin to stuff Tangiers soap and towels into their  luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs, he takes us for two  million... and upstairs he takes  free soap, shampoo and towels. Another  billionaire cheapskate who loves his  free rooms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tangiers jet with the Tangiers logo on its side as  ICHIKAWA shakes ACE's hands before boarding. SHERBERT fol him and his associates aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...free private jets, and two million  of our money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we got him back. I had our pilot  tell him the plane was on the fritz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERBERT apologizes to ICHIKAWA and his entourage as they all get off the jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, I don't know what the hell went  wrong. I'm awfully sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big problem. Big problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't understand it. These  mechanical things, you know, they  happen. Hey, be-better here than (gesturing to the sky) up there, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERBERT arguing with TICKET AGENT as ICHIKAWA and entour look glum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he missed the commercial flights  connecting with Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. There's a convention  in town, and all flights are booked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convention? (Turning to ICHIKAWA) I can't believe that there's a  convention. It's never... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smiling ACE greets ICHIKAWA and his entourage as they d up and get out of Tangiers limos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him back ...with a whole floor  of rooms for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you missed the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get my money back, right? (Chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. No gambling. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ICHIKAWA, with the Japanese woman, picks up some chips an places them on the table. ACE and SHERBERT watch from beh a barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bet one thousand a hand instead  of his usual thirty thousand a hand. A dealer's hands slide two cards on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank wins a natural eight over a  five. Another dealer's hands place two chips on a table. ICHIKA looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I knew, the trick with whales  like Ichikawa was that they can't  bet small for long. He didn't think  of it as winning ten thousand, he  thought of it as losing ninety  thousand. ICHIKAWA places a larger bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he upped his bets... A dealer picks up some chips from a rack and places them the table. ICHIKAWA is now seated with stacks of chips in front of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until he dropped his winnings  back and gave up a million of his  own cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ICHIKAWA, hours later, his chips depleted. ACE and SHERBE still watch from behind the barrier as millions in chips back in the dealer's racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the casino, the cardinal rule is  to keep them playing... Move in on ACE as he smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and keep them coming back. The  longer they play, the more they lose.  In the end, we get it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE, with pit bosses next to him, looks out over the huge casino where hundreds of thousands of dollars are being p into machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Vegas, everybody's gotta watch  everybody else. Camera reveals the DEALER at a craps table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six, an easy way. Six! All right,  who's gonna give me...  The DEALER places some chips on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the players are looking to  beat the casino... THE CAMERA IS ON THE DEALER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...both dice must hit that back wall  each and every roll. All right, make  a six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the dealers are watching the  players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby, make a six! A BOX MAN, seated mid-table is watching the DEALER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The box men are watching the dealers. CAMERA PANS TO THE DEALER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Humming, fielding,  every roll.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor men are watching the box  men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pit bosses are watching the floor  men. SWISH PAN TO A SHIFT BOSS SURVEYING THE CASINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shift bosses are watching the  pit bosses. SWISH PAN TO SHERBERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino manager is watching the  shift bosses. SWISH PAN TO ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watching the casino manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the eye-in-the-sky is watching  us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video monitors show a dealer fanning a row of bills. Swis pan to ACE and SHERBERT watching the monitor. ACE lights cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we had a dozen guys up there,  most of them ex-cheats, who knew  every trick in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger squeals as she throws the dice across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. She rolls a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles) I told you I was hot tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound out: The monitor shows GINGER and the HIGH ROLLER  cheering, she throws her arms around him. The crowd goes  crazy. SWISH PAN TO ACE LOOKING ON INTENTLY. On screen, GINGER's hand sneaks a chip from the rack and  subtly moves it towards her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound in: GINGER slips the chip quietly into her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off-screen) Let's go. This is for Ginger. Come  on. This is for Ginger. The HIGH ROLLER notices GINGER's hand on her purse. She  pretends to have taken out her lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have a hundred on the hard  ten. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard ten. One hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE continues to look at the monitor. SHERBERT and a secu man seated at a video console also look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A craps stick pushes some dice towards GINGER. She rolls  again, only this time she craps out. Gamblers groan, then applaud her. She's made so much money for the table that winners toss chips in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm sorry. (To the table) Thank you very much. Thank you very  much. ACE and two casino execs are now on the floor watching he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir, I appreciate that.  Everybody, thanks. Gives some chips  as tips to the dealer and box man.  Thanks. Take care, Steve. Take chances  and drive fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger, honey, this is for you love.  Thanks for your time. She turns to the HIGH ROLLER, who is handing her a thin s of chips worth about $2,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, 'What's the matter?'  I made a lot of money for you. I  want my cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money? I've seen you stealing  from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money?  Look at this stack of  chips. Don't give me that shit. I  want my end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger, I've been watching you all  night. You've been stealing from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that shit. I want my  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bag's full of fuckin' chips you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) What do you mean 'stole'? I didn't  steal anything from you. ACE watches the argument heat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost, Ginger! Get lost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. GINGER knocks the chip rack out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how 'bout that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! (He bends down to  pick them up.) Gamblers and dealers shout and yell. She picks up another rack of chips and tosses them into the air, then another, and another. Chips fly all over the casino. Everyone star diving for chips. Dealers. Players. Security guards.   Waitresses. Pit bosses. Bedlam. ACE and the two execs with him are the only ones not divi for chips. He looks at GINGER. She looks at him. FREEZE FRAME ON GINGER. Slow motion: GINGER smiles at ACE and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a move. I fell in love right  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and ACE are seated on a banquette. Close up of his hand attaching a diamond and ruby pin to her dress. Tilt to GINGER's smiling face beaming at ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in Vegas, for a girl like Ginger,  love costs money. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go powder my nose. (ACE hands GINGER a  single $50 bill. She  smiles coyly. He  hands her another  fifty.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger's mission in life was money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from following scene) See you, Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: GINGER waves goodbye to the DOORMAN and walks towards two VALET PARKERS who greet her warmly. She gets a bottle of  pills from one of them and slips some cash into his hand return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you for asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a queen around the casino.  She brought in high rollers and helped  them spread around a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To VALET PARKERS) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ginger, how you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (Handing the VALET  some money.) And I have something for you. You  got me covered? The VALET PARKER places a vial of pills in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Something for you, there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you do. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: GINGER hands the pills to HIGH ROLLER #2 in his hotel  bathroom, where he is washing his face and trying to ener himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some lucky pills for you, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who didn't want Ginger? She was one  of the best-known, best-liked and  most respected hustlers in town.   Smart hustlers like her could keep a  guy awake for two or three days before  sending him home broke to the little  woman and his bank examiners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER comes back from the ladies room. She kisses ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles) I hit a few... uh, games on the way  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was all bullshit. She just  pocketed the cash.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: GINGER converts her chips into a pile of $100 bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To CASHIER) How you doin' tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighing) Oh, beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger had the hustler's code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take one for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (While she counts out  the cash) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew how to take care of people.  And that's what Vegas was all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As she pushes a stack  of $100 bills across  the counter) Sixty-eight hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks She picks up the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Kickback City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You too. Close-up of GINGER folding a $100 bill and placing it in palm. She slips the folded bill deftly into the palm of a floor manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took care of the dealers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...pit bosses, floor managers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But mostly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER, on her way out of the casino, passes a folded $10 bill to a smiling older SHIFT BOSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she took care of the valet parkers,  the guys who could get you anything  and take care of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER exits and gets into her car, slipping a VALET PARK a $100 bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger took care of the parkers  because they took care of the security  guards, who took care of the metro  cops, who let her operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting into her car) I need that stuff tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valet parking job was such a  money-maker that they had to pay off  the hotel manager just to get the  concession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER enters the room with $25,000 in her hands. She tap LESTER DIAMOND's leg with it and he turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But one thing I could never  understand, was that she could have  everything under control, except for  her old pimp boyfriend, Lester  Diamond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Gin, you know I got other people  in this. I got partners. But I want  you to understand that I am lookin'  out for you in this thing.  Okay?   You're going to get yours back...    and you're gonna get it back first.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you goin'? Where are you?  You're in that place. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. Where are you? Where  are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. He hastily kisses GINGER and slips out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ginger I knew wouldn't even look  at this creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a moocher, a card cheat, a  country-club golf hustler. A  scumbag... chasing dentists for a  few bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. GINGER looks out of the window and sees LESTER get into a convertible and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, the guy was always broke, he  always had a story. And somehow, she  could never turn him down. The way  Ginger saw it, I guess, was that  Lester was just an unlucky guy.  Somebody had to take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY, his wife JENNIFER, with a beehive hairdo, and thei eight-year-old son LITTLE NICKY, are detained while their luggage is searched by a customs agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nobody had to take care of Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To customs agent) You find any cash in there, we'll  whack it up with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, he took care of himself only  too well. And that's why every badge  back home wanted to nail him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To customs agent) Excuse me, but I folded these things  beautifully and I would appreciate a  little respect. Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, pal. I gotta live  with her. We see MARINO waiting for NICKY outside the customs area. Two COPS push past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even after a little vacation, they  hassled him at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Frank Marino was there to  meet him, but so were the cops. This  time they wanted to pinch him for  some diamond burglary in Antwerp. CAMERA DOLLIES IN ON JENNIFER'S BEEHIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Will you help me fold these,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were ready to blame him for  anything, no matter where it happened.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH FORWARD
dialogues.text: NICKY, JENNIFER, LITTLE NICKY and MARINO walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To LITTLE NICKY) You go and put your things away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they were usually right. NICKY, JENNIFER and MARINO are gathered around the kitche table. JENNIFER leans over and starts to shake her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold it. Here. NICKY places a red towel down on the table. JENNIFER lean over again, tugs and shakes her hair until diamonds begin fall out of her beehive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Nicky enjoyed being a  gangster, and he didn't give a damn  who knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. There we go. Look at that.  Beautiful. Diamonds fall on the red towel in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, that's what worried me, 'cause  it turns out Nicky was about to be  sent to Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we're clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more! There's a couple stuck  in there. I know there's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'm telling you, they're out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, damn it. Don't get so  defensive. It could be stuck in your  hair, you know. NICKY grasps JENNIFER's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there aren't... (A diamond falls out  of her beehive.) There aren't but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there aren't? (Showing her the  diamond.) What's that? (Slaps her.) Huh? What's that. (FRANK chuckles.) There's no more. Thanks, hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't wait to get my hands on  Vegas. But the bosses didn't send me  out there to have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Mob bosses FORLANO, CAPELLI, GAGGI, BORELLI and PISCANO s around the back room table eating and talking as in the  opening vignette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sent me out there to make sure  that nobody fucked with Ace and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE opens the door to NICKY and JENNIFER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nobody interfered with the fuckin'  skim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Opening door) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doin'? (Kisses ACE.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey, Sammy, how are you? JENNIFER and NICKY take in ACE's spectacular Vegas-style  penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, look at this place, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin', huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling her over) Ginger. GINGER emerges from the bedroom. NICKY and JENNIFER are b stunned by her beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) Holy shit, what've you been doin'  out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, come here. She walks to them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jennifer and Nick. They're  dear friends of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shaking hands) Good to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure. (Grasping GINGER's  hand and kissing it.) Very nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and NICKY are driving through town, the neon lights o Vegas reflected in the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we ate, we left Jennifer and  Ginger alone and we took a ride to  talk. And then... he hit me with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about me movin'  out here? (ACE looks away.) What's the matter? You got a problem  with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Playfully) You mean, I have your permission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, you have my permission. But I -  I just gotta tell you it's no joke  out here. It's no joke, you know?   You gotta keep a low profile. It's  not like back home. Right off the  bat, they don't like guys like us.  And this sheriff's a real cowboy.  Even the coppers aren't afraid to  bury people out in the desert here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. I want to get away  from back home for a while. I'm tired  of that shit back there. (Referring to the  Vegas lights.) Look at this place. It's made of  money. You know what the best part  is? Nobody's gonna know what we're  doin'! There's nobody here to see  us! Everybody's back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I gotta tell you, I got pinched  twice for no reason. You really gotta  be careful. I'm running a licensed  place. Everything's legit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. I'm not gonna  do anything. What am I gonna do?   I'm especially not gonna involve you  in anything. ACE gives NICKY a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and MARINO pull up in their car and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace saw Vegas one way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call this guy and tell him I'm  comin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. They walk into the sportsbook, past numerous bar patrons gamblers to TONY, the bookie at a betting counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I saw it another. I saw it as  untouched. I mean, they had bookies,  pimps and drug dealers I could shake  down. Who the fuck were they gonna  run to?  So, I started getting  everybody in line. Best of all, for  the first time in my life, I figured  out a way not to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he had a fool-proof scheme,  all right. It wasn't very scientific  but it worked. When he won, he  collected. When he lost, he told the  bookies to go fuck themselves. What  were they gonna do? Muscle Nicky? (Chuckles.) Nicky was the muscle. NICKY grabs TONY by the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, yeah. You got that thing  for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What thing? Oh, Nicky... I thought  you was layin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was layin'? No, no, I'm taking it.  I was takin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a little confused here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a little confused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to a window,  above a counter with  a tiny opening to  talk through) Maybe if I stick your fuckin' face  through this window over here like,  you know, you'll - you'll get  unconfused. Give me the fuckin' money! TONY takes some money out of his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Groaning) I'm sorry, Nicky. I didn't mean  anything by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, that's why you had it  ready. You thought I was fuckin'  layin' it?! He smacks the bookie on the head with the wad of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gasps) My fuckin' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fuckin' head, huh? Don't fuck  around, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to TONY) Smarten up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walking out) You jag-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) And now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and JENNIFER stand in the background with other par listening to a NUN school teacher. LITTLE NICKY and other youngsters are seated at small children's desks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nicholas Santoro will come up and  tell us about our first president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stepping up in front  of the class to begin  a speech) George Washington was born in a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still, it was nice and quiet for  a while. Ginger and I presented Nicky  and Jennifer all over town, like  regular Ozzie and Harriets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...typical Virginia farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and DETECTIVE BOB JOHNSON are coaching their sons.  JOHNSON pats LITTLE NICKY on the back and with encouragin words sends him running on to the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To LITTLE NICKY) Beautiful. You got a beautiful swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace got my son, little Nicky, involved  with Little League, and it was great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I want you to get out there and  get me singles and doubles, okay?   'Cause that's what's gonna win this  game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turned out to be one of the other  coaches was a fuckin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go out there and show your dad  what you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...metro intelligence cop. But it  didn't matter. I mean, it was all  about the kids, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, he's gotta realize  everything can't be a home run that  he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that's exactly what I  keep tellin' him, but that's the  kind of kid he is ever since he's  born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's instinctive, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to do everything... LITTLE NICKY hits the ball, NICKY and DETECTIVE JOHNSON  applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, Nicky being Nicky, he made his  presence known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY saunters through the casino and up to EDDY and JERR two well-dressed hoods who are signing papers at the cash credit window near ACE and SHERBERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially at the casino, where he  definitely did not work, people got  the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? That's why the bosses sent me  out here. They wanted me to make  sure none of the other crews robbed  the joint. Like these two fuckin'  balloon-heads over here [EDDY and  JERRY]. They were gonna try and bang  us out of two hundred fuckin' grand? (Chuckling.) Yeah, right, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shakes NICKY's hand) Hey, Nicky. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nicky, how are you? What are  you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm over here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In unison) You're over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm over here with him. SWISH PAN TO ACE WITH SHERBERT OFF TO THE SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waiting on Carmine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're lookin' for Carmine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine? He was here before. I saw  him. He had a suitcase and everything,  and then he left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, you know, maybe he went  across the street or somewhere else  or somethin'. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, listen, uh... Good luck with  the joint, huh? (Shakes hands with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks, Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shakes NICKY's hand) Yeah, lots of luck. Lots of luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, great, Jerry. They walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck to you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY from behind  the cage) Hey, they forgot to sign their papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They forgot to sign their papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they don't need those anymore. He looks over to ACE and SHERBERT. NICKY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of respect, guys from other crews  got away with a warning. ACE taking a drag off his cigarette, nods an 'okay'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody else: watch out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blackjack WINNER, who looks like a school teacher, with over $100,000 in chips before him has gathered a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like these yokels here who never  heard of Nicky or the bosses back  home, 'cause they're the morons who  give you the most trouble. Even after  we'd catch 'em, they'd try sneakin'  back with beards and wigs and fake  noses. ACE and SHERBERT walk up to watch the WINNER who is playi all six hands at the blackjack table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can spot these assholes by  watching the way they bet. Like this  guy. He's bettin' lavender chips at  five hundred each with only one little  problem. He's always guessed right.   If he wasn't so fuckin' greedy, he'd  have been tougher to spot. But in  the end, they're all greedy. ACE walks around the WINNER's table, past the crowd, to t pit. Behind him are more blackjack tables, dealers and  players. ACE bends down and ties his shoelace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw that the dealer was weak, but  he wasn't in on it. The DEALER's hands lift the corner of his hole card a hal an inch to determine the casino's hand against the WINNER The slightly exposed hole card is a six of clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wasn't protecting his hand.  He was lifting his hole card way to  high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, here's this guy... OVERHEAD PAN FROM THE SIGNALER SLUMPED IN HIS SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...reading the dealer's hole card... PAN CONTINUES PAST ACE TO REVEAL THE WINNER'S TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and signaling his buddy [the  WINNER] at this table.

dialogues.speaker: TAPPING HIS THIGH.
dialogues.text: We see through his trousers, that he is tapping a copper  transmitter with a battery pack attached. Back at the WINNER's table we see inside his pant leg whe a device strapped to his leg is receiving the impulse sig buzz - buzz - buzz - from the SIGNALER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's just what these hustlers  look for. They cruise from casino to  casino, lookin' for weak dealers the  way lions look for weak antelope. ACE starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) Operator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is on the house phone right near the SIGNALER's table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mr R. Get me Armstrong and  Friday over at pit two right away. He hangs up, and fixes his tie in the mirrored panel abov the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SLOWLY BEGIN TO GATHER AROUND IT.
dialogues.text: ACE, waiting, lights a cigarette. ARMSTRONG joins ACE. Th look towards the SIGNALER's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ARMSTRONG) BJ nineteen, second base, the beard  [Blackjack table number 19, second  position, man with the beard]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Picks up the phone  again.) Operator... I need Mr Happy, loud. On ACE's signal, WAITRESSES, one carrying a cake with a  sparkling candle, start singing 'Happy Birthday', attract the crowd's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In unison) Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday  to you. Happy Birthday, dear Jeff.  Happy Birthday to you. Gamblers cheer and applaud. ACE nods and ARMSTRONG lets a long metal object drop out  from under his jacket sleeve and moves in close behind th SIGNALER, as though looking at the game. He presses the object - a cattle prod - under the SIGNALE arm near his heart. The SIGNALER instantly goes into  convulsions, falling to the floor gasping and groaning.  Several SECURITY GUARDS grab the SIGNALER as he falls.   ARMSTRONG walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man down! The WINNER sees what happened to his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notify medical! We got a cardiac  arrest here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine, folks. Just give us some  room, please! ACE watches the scene. The guards lift the stunned SIGNAL to his feet and help him away from the table. Play is  immediately resumed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it now. The WINNER hurriedly places his chips into racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never know what hit them. And  if and when... SECURITY GUARDS drag the SIGNALER out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they do find out they just got  zapped by a cattle prod... SHERBERT follows the WINNER as he rushes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they wish they really did have a  heart attack. ACE exits behind the GUARDS and the SIGNALER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grim, windowless utility room with tools on racks along the walls, some plain wooden chairs, and a workbench tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out this guy and his fuckin'  pals, they were knockin' this place  dead for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a wire on him. The SIGNALER is roughly shoved into the room. A SECURITY  GUARD tears his trousers down revealing the signaling dev strapped to his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, what are you doin', man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Exposing the device) There it is! On the table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheater's justice! The SIGNALER is slammed down face first on the bench and two GUARDS spread his arms out on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In pain) Oh, God! Oh! Another GUARD starts up a power saw and approaches the  SIGNALER who is now pinned to the table. He starts to scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no! No! No! ACE walks toward the table, gesturing for the GUARD to tu off the saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to make an example of these  pricks that the party was over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To relieved SIGNALER) I'm just curious. I saw you shuffling  your checks with your right hand.  Can you do that with both hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do it with both hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it with your left hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... I never tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're a righty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye-yeah. ACE nods to one of the GUARDS. Instantly a large rubber m smashes onto the man's right hand four times to the sound screams. ACE watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you're gonna have to learn with  your left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God! (He moans and sits  back.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) It's a hundred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WINNER has been standing outside the cashier's cage  waiting for his $110,000 in chips to be cashed. SHERBERT  walks up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a hundred ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya. That's a lot of money to be  counting out in public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To CASHIER) Why don't I take him over to the  office and verify it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little privacy. And, by the way,  send over a... nice bottle of  champagne on ice, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real special.  Somethin'... (To WINNER.) By the way...  I'm Billy Sherbert,  your casino manager. He shakes hands with the WINNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.
