dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a good time? SHERBERT leads him away from the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll want to count the money in  privacy. You know, you don't need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I have a plane to catch to  Cleveland...  Can I get my winnings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WINNER is pushed through the door by two GUARDS follo by SHERBERT and sees his pal moaning in pain and holding broken hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what they did to my hand, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walks over to the

dialogues.speaker: WINNER
dialogues.text: All right, I'm gonna give you a  choice. You can either have the money  and the hammer or you can walk out  of here. You can't have both. What  do you want? SHERBERT stands next to the WINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget to tell your friends  what happens if they fuck around in  here. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I made a bad mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' right, you made a bad  mistake. 'Cause if you come back  here - we catch either one of you -  we're gonna break your fuckin' heads  and you won't walk out of here. You  see that fuckin' saw?  We're gonna  use it. You don't fuck around in  this place. You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The GUARDS usher the WINNER out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the GUARDS,  referring to the

dialogues.speaker: SIGNALER
dialogues.text: Throw him out in the alley.  And  just tell the cops he got hit by a  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER are alone in the living room. The apartmen looks out on the glittering neon signs of the Strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within no time, everything was set  in place. We got rid of the freelance  scamsters. The per was way up.  The  gods were happy, or as happy as the  gods can ever be.  And I, I decided  to complicate my life. For a guy who  likes sure things, I was about to  bet the rest of my life on a real  longshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting any younger. Don't  you think it's time? Aren't you  gettin' tired of all this shit?  Bangin' around, hustlin' around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you trying to handicap me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do you one better. I'm  trying to marry you. You want to  marry me? (GINGER looks doubtful.) I'm serious. I mean, I - I want to  settle down. I want a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs, laughing) You got the wrong girl, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'd be a good father. I know  you'd be a good mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me. What, you've known  me, two, three months. What do you  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm forty-three years old. I don't  want to wait. I know you well enough  to know that I really love you very  much.  And I can't think of anybody  better to be with. And I don't feel  like waiting anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know a lot of happily married  people, Sam? 'Cause I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care about you, a - But I just  don't have those kind of feelings  for you. I'm sorry. I'm not in love  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Brushing cigarette  ash off his dressing  gown) I - I - I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand? (Pause) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I - I... mean...  that can grow  as I - as long as there's a mutual  respect... that kind of thing can  grow. I'm realistic. I can accept  that. But, you know, what is...   What is love anyway?  It's a... it's  a mutual respect. It's - it's a  devotion. It's a... it's a caring  from one person to another. And if  we could set up some kind of  foundation...  based on that mutual  respect...  I feel that eventually  you would care enough about me...  that I could live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it doesn't work out. You know, if  it doesn't play out, then what happens  to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm doin' well now. And I'm  gonna do even better. And so, whatever  happens, if it doesn't work out  between us, I'm gonna make sure you're  okay for the rest of your life. And  if there are kids, especially, you  know, I'll take care of you better  than you'd ever imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) What're you... what're you pitching  me, here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I said. You'll be set up  for the rest of your life. That I  can promise you. (Pause) Want to take a chance? She looks at him. ACE is holding her hand tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER are seated at a banquet table with various guests, drinking champagne. AMY, their six-month-old chil is in a cradle. NICKY and JENNIFER are hovering around th baby with LITTLE NICKY and are blissfully happy. It is an elegant affair.  City Officials, politicians and gaming  officials are there, plus, SHERBERT and Ace's boss, PHILI GREEN. A photographer takes pictures of the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I married Ginger I knew all the  stories, but I didn't give a fuck.  'I'm Sam Rothstein,' I said. 'I can  change her.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was typical Ace. He invited the  biggest people in town and he knew  they'd show. Because he knew they  all wanted somethin' from him.  With  Ace, nobody ever got a free ride.  Even Ginger. With her - We see AMY in the cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - he still covered his bets. They  had to have the baby first, before  they got married. Even made Jennie  and me watch Amy for a few days when  they went on their honeymoon. But I  didn't mind, we loved the kid.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDE AND GROOM FIGURINES ON THE CAKE.
dialogues.text: LESTER's and GINGER's telephone conversation is heard in  voice-over this scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Can you feel my eyes on you? Can you  feel me look into your heart?  Can  you feel me in the pit of your  stomach? Can you feel me in you? In  your heart? We see a wide view of the elaborate wedding, guests mill  about the banquet hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me come there. Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone,  sobbing) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESTER DIAMOND is talking on the phone softly, cutting up cocaine on a piece of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Bub-ut, baby, do you know that I  love you too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No, Lester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah. This is the best thing I can  do for my life right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is sitting alone on the phone. She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) So, it's gonna be okay, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing, into  telephone) Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) God... I wish you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a beautiful scantily dressed blonde girl in the  apartment with him. She bends down to the table in front him, snorts some cocaine, then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...all the luck in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, I do. I mean, it's - it's the -  it's the best thing you can do right  now. I mean this. And you'll have  real security.  Sweetheart... you're  gonna be situated just right in Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE enters from the ballroom and sees GINGER on the phone He walks towards her, listening to her conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Come on, this is great for us. You  know I'm gonna be here for you. I  ain't going no place. Huh?  I'm  lookin' at you right now. I'm seein'  you for the very first time, right  this minute. I'm seein' you, and I  can feel my heart click. I see you  fourteen years old. I see you the  first second I ever saw you. I see  you, long-legged little colt - GINGER notices ACE behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - with stupid braces on your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone,  sniffing, trying to  cut him off) Okay, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Every time I ever see you, that's  what I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Uh, talk to you later.  Bye. (She hangs up the  phone quickly.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Drinking some  champagne, wiping  away tears) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Laughs) I'm not crying. (Sniffs.) ACE walks up behind GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you shouldn't drink so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I just - (Sniffs) You just have to understand. I've  been with Lester since I was a kid.  I just wanted to say goodbye. I - I  just...  I don't... I think I have a  right to do that. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. That part of your  life is over with. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're with me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. They are reflected in a mirror behind the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go? Let's go back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sniffs) Okay. ACE's hands pick up a white rose and GINGER's gloves from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER drive up to an expensive house which backs to a country-club golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE takes GINGER inside. It is fancy and lush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Through sliding glass doors, we see a patio and a pool ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighing) It's great. The living-room has exposed white brick along the walls,  bronze ostrich figurines, a white baby grand piano, and a zebra print rug surrounded by a few couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE takes GINGER past the bedroom to their huge room-size closet. There are racks and racks of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Running into the  closet) Oh! It's all my stuff. Oh, my God. ACE presents her with a long chinchilla coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought all my stuff. I can - She sees the coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it on. It's yours. He puts it on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) You're kidding? My God. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's chinchilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking at herself  in the mirror) Oh, it's so soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... ACE Kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever been so nice to me. They kiss and embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE's hand opens a leather case full of gold Bvlgari jewe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gasps) Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER lie on the bed, surrounded by jewelry. GIN is swathed in the chinchilla coat. Ace watches as a trans GINGER tries on gold necklaces, rings, bracelets and earr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you think it's too much if I  wear these in the same day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do whatever you want. Do I keep  my promises, or do I keep my promises? ACE kisses GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so wonderful. The jewelry's  not so bad, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing is... you shouldn't  keep this in the house. We gotta put  it in a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Putting on a gold  bracelet) Come on. Can I keep this one in the  house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look, (gently holding her  face, gathering her  total attention) pay attention to me. What I'm gonna tell you is very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this stuff doesn't mean anything.  Money, this, doesn't mean anything  without trust. I have to be able to  trust you with my life.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE IN
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER get off the Tangiers jet carrying two  suitcases. ACE gives a chauffeur the luggage and follows  GINGER into a brown Rolls Royce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With over a million in cash and jewels  tucked in a bank in Vegas only for  Ginger, she was secure and happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER walk into the bank lobby carrying the  suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loved that shit. But a guy in my  line of work has to have a lot of  pay-off cash around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several safe deposit boxes filled with cash. AC and GINGER are closing a large box so crammed with cash t ACE has to lean on it for the clasp to lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crooked cops and kidnappers, they  don't take checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a little help with that, Mr  Collins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I put two million in cash in a  Los Angeles bank under the name of  Mr and Mrs Tom Collins. This was  strictly my shakedown and kidnapping  money. ACE and GINGER struggle to push the crammed box into a sl in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, since I'd either be in jail or  locked in a closet when I needed the  money the most... The BANK PRESIDENT joins them, and he and ACE simultaneou double-lock the outer safe box door with two separate key after which, ACE gives GINGER his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I gave Ginger the only key to the  cash that could get me back alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is on the other side of a glass wall, signing pape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is just a signature card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, once she signs those papers,  she'll be the only person to have  total access to the box?  No one  else, including myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We see GINGER looking at ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way you wanted it, right? ACE nods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly.) Sam, let me ask you a question. You  must really trust your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Yeah, sure I do. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, tha-that's good. It's just  unusual. To tell you the truth, so  many of my clients don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... ACE looks over to GINGER, smiles and winks. She looks bac at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY VALE sings to a seated audience. ACE sits alone at table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Ginger and the money in place,  I felt covered, and to play it safe  I switched job titles again and made  myself, um, Food and Beverage  Director. This way nobody would bother  me about a license. I mean, Vegas  was like a dream for me. Trouble  was... NICKY is seated at another table with MARINO, peeling off money and giving it to MIKE, a crooked dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nicky was dreamin' his own kind  of Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To begin, I put money out on the  streets, chargin' three points a  week. You know - juice to the fuckin'  dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MIKE) Don't make us come lookin' for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you won't have to look for me. I  appreciate it. Thanks, Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mike. MIKE gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were degenerate gamblers, coke  freaks. In no time, I had half the  dealers in the Tangiers in my pocket.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is at a table with his gang of card sharks: SLIM, R MOOSH and COWBOY, all secretly signaling each other,  sandbagging a mark. MIKE, the crooked dealer from the pre scene, deals NICKY a winning hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the next thing I did, I started  bustin' out high-stakes poker players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was so obvious. I mean, all of  Nicky's half-assed mechanics, they  were real signal happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Scratching his arm) I'm gonna open for five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moosh, you open? (Taps his fingers on  some chips before  picking them up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signaling back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet thirty-five hundred. NICKY wiggles a toothpick back and forth in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been losing for three days  straight, non-stop. Another shark pulls on his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, why're you crying, with three  loaves of bread under your arm? ACE watches their signals with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky thought nobody was watching  him. But he was wrong. We see two undercover gaming agents, looking like tourist sneaking looks at NICKY's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I didn't want any of those agents  near my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four aces, Doc. His hands spread five cards on the table, showing four ac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting up in disgust) Jesus Christ. I can't believe it. COWBOY, the card shark with the cowboy hat, rakes in a la pot toward his side of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't have bad luck, I wouldn't  have any luck. I'm out of here, you  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I wished to God Nicky and  his whole crew would just get lost. He walks towards NICKY's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do? Go back home and  start a war? ACE leans down to talk to NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Nicky's a made guy and I'm  not. I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering in NICKY's  ear) Be careful. Gaming agents are all  over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm lucky. I'm not allowed to  get lucky in this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been lucky all week. They're  lookin' to nail ya. ACE walks away. NICKY looks over at the gaming agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace was so fuckin' worried about his  casino, he forgot what we were doin'  out here in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security people are pulling apart a husband and wife who fighting. Camera picks up ACE as he passes by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million times I wanted to yell in  his fuckin' ear: 'This is Las Vegas!   We're supposed to be out here robbin',  you dumb fuckin' Heeb.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closeup of the COWBOY's white-socked feet with no shoes o poker table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SHERBERT, referring  to COWBOY) I don't give a shit who he's connected  to. Tell him to take his fuckin'  feet off the table. What's he think  this is, a goddamn sawdust joint? SHERBERT approaches COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, would you mind taking your feet  off the table and putting your shoes  on, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs) Yeah, I would mind. I'm havin' a bad  night. COWBOY remains the same with his feet on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Returning to ACE) Fuckin' asshole won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call security. ACE approaches COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You want to do me a favor? You  want to take your feet off the table  and put your shoes back on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. ACE walks to nearby SECURITY GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To GUARDS) I want you to exit this guy off the  premises, and I want you to exit him  off his feet and use his head to  open the fuckin' door. Three SECURITY GUARDS approach COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you're gonna have to leave. You  mind accompanying us outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, I ain't goin' anywhere  with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, you're out of here, cowboy! SECURITY GUARD #1 knocks his feet off the table, as GUARD #2 and #3 lift him off his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who you're fuckin' with?!  Huh? Do you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now move along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Screaming at ACE who  follows him) You fuckin' faggot! Do you know who  you're fuckin' with? The GUARDS carry him out and forcefully shove him towards side exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grunting) You've gotta be kidding me! (Groans.) The GUARDS lift him off his feet and, holding him like a  battering ram, smash his head into the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As COWBOY is thrown  out the door) Sure enough, an hour later, I get  the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is on a public wall-phone talking to ACE. MARINO is staring at the disheveled COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Ace, what happened over there? I  mean, did you know that guy you threw  out was with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is on a Tangiers house phone. SHERBERT looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) No, I didn't know that. But you know  what he did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY gives COWBOY a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) He insulted Billy. And then I walked  over to him politely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...and he tells me to go fuck myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Then he called me a faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) So what do you think I do? I threw  that cocksucker out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) What? Ho- (He puts down the  phone; to COWBOY:) Hey, come here. COWBOY walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called my friend a faggot? You  tell him to go fuck himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, I did -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did - I didn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to go fuck himself? You  fuckin' hick!  Fuckin'... NICKY hits him on the head with the phone. COWBOY falls b groaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE listens to the noise of NICKY roughing up COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...you big fuckin' hick, you. Come  here. Come here. Get him up. Come  here. ACE LOOKS AT SHERBERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COWBOY) Come here, come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go over there right now and you  apologize. You better hope he lets  you back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) If you ever get out of line over  there again, I'll smash your fuckin'  head so hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COWBOY) ...you won't be able to get that  cowboy hat on. You hear me? Fuckin'  hick. (Into telephone) Sammy, listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...this guy obviously doesn't know  who he was talkin' to, you understand?  He doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...know that, uh, we're dear friends.  I mean, he's already very sorry.  But, uh, if you could do me a favor  to let him back in, I swear to you  he'll never get out of line again. I  promise you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) If he does it again, he's out for  good. I don't care what it is, Nick,  I'm gonna ha- I'll - I'll never let  him in the place again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) I'm sorry about this. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) All right, Ace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Thanks, pal. NICKY hangs up the phone and turns to COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took your boots off? You put  your feet on the table... you shit- kicking, stinky, horse-manure-smellin'  motherfucker you!  You fuck me up  over there, I'll stick you in a hole  in the fuckin' desert! You understand? (Slapping him.) Go over there and apologize. (Kicking the chastened  COWBOY away.) Go! Get the fuck out of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiger leaps towards the camera, which pans over to two  showgirls and then to ACE's hand holding the key to a Rol Royce. He gives it to JONATHAN and DAVID as reporters rus in to photograph the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Ace could be a very touchy  guy, especially when he got bigger  and bigger in town. Like when he  hired that Jonathon and David and  their tigers away from the Palace by  buildin' them a new stage and then  givin' them a silver Rolls Royce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and SHERBERT watch as a STAGE MANAGER weighs in the ' Fatale' Showgirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll tell you, he knew how to  bring in the crowds. He knew all the  fuckin' angles. He brought over the  whole 'Femme Fatale' show from Paris.  But he forgot how lazy them European  dancin' broads can get. I mean, he  had to weigh 'em in once a week to  make sure they didn't blow up like  fuckin' balloons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SHOWGIRL) You're still eight pounds over. (To MANAGER.) What's the reason for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein, sir, let me put her on  suspension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind the 'sir'. Never mind the  'sir'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she eight pounds over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...trying to offer you the respect  that your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Mr Rothstein' is good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein... well, sometimes,  when you reach that pressure point,  when you put that pressure point on  them, you know, it shows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could at least lose half a pound  or a quarter.  Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she doesn't always -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all you do is give me answers.  Just - just give me the right answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir. Well, I don't know why. I  guess, maybe, because she's frightened  that if she doesn't lose the weight  she may even get fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. She will get fired. In  fact, I want you to send her back to  Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always been our policy -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just stop everything. SHERBERT and ACE walk away across a huge stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) This woman's an institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what she is. She's an  institution, that's the problem.  She's lazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE standing in a large space surrounded by giant TV scre showing sports events. Around him, long rows of bettors a seated at betting stations, lined up at windows, or wande around at the bar. It's like a NASA control room on launc day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I gotta give the guy credit. He  does the most obvious thing. This is  the only town in the country where a  bookie joint is legit, so, why not  take advantage, right?  So... he  took bookie joints off the street  and then opened them up inside the  casino. Well, within a few years, by  doin' all of this, he had every casino  on the Strip trying to copy off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY, with MARINO, punching and kicking a man next to th open door of his luxury car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my innovations... The man falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Nicky's dedication to his  job... NICKY starts kicking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I soon had the best operation on  the Strip. NICKY lifts an empty trash can and shatters the car's  windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and NICKY are standing on the casino floor near the s machines. Gamblers are milling about behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better watch yourself. There's a  lot of heat on you already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, somebody's complaining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm - I'm hearin' things from  security. They're all ex-cops. The  Sheriff's lookin' to bust your balls.  They want to put you in the Black  Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Black Book is a bunch of  bullshit. They got two names in there  for the whole country and one of  them is still Al Capone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit or no bullshit, they put  you in that book, you're gonna be in  a lot of trouble. You will not be  able to walk into the casino. I'm  tellin' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doin' out here? I'm tryin'  to make a livin', that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tellin' you. Don't say I  didn't warn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on the filaments of a flash bulb as they ignite. TV news crews and still photographers are taking pictures ACE and GINGER surrounded by clusters of celebrities and Vegas power elite, including SHERBERT and GREEN, at a bla tie event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Rothstein, look straight ahead.  Very nice. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, nice smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look right at the camera. Hold  that pose. We hear GREEN making a speech over flashing cameras and f frames of himself, SHERBERT, ACE and GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering all of his hard work and  dedication and the new lifeblood he  has instilled in Las Vegas... We now see GREEN at a mike speaking in front of the seate club members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has established himself as an  indispensable member of the gaming  community. As the head of the Tangiers  Gaming Corporation, it's my pleasure  to welcome Sam Rothstein to the Vegas  Valley Country Club. Members cheer and applaud as GREEN hands ACE a framed  citation. It reads: 'This Certificate of Appreciation. Sa Rothstein. Charitable Foundations of Greater Las Vegas'.  They shake hands for the photographers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home, they would have put me in  jail for what I'm doing. But out  here, they're givin' me awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into the microphone) It's with great pleasure that I accept  this certificate of appreciation  from the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dazzling GINGER moves charmingly about the room chattin up top executives, lawyers, judges, bankers and their wiv ACE, standing with GREEN and an elderly man, watches her  work the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam raised more than we've ever raised  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He worked so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my greatest pleasure was watchin'  my wife, Ginger, work the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all loved her. How could you  not live her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COUNTRY-CLUB WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could be the most charming woman  you ever saw. People loved to be  around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you've got to bring Amy to  Sasha's birthday party because he'd  love to have her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you three o'clock Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Yes, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made everybody feel good. GINGER joins ACE. He smiles proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and ACE are off alone by a dining-room table, talk intently. A young casino EXECUTIVE interrupts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shaking his hand) Oh, thanks. The flirting EXECUTIVE looks at GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs Rothstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. GINGER gives the flirting EXECUTIVE her hand, he kisses i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of the most gorgeous women  I've ever seen. You're a lucky man  Mr Rothstein. ACE watches as GINGER flashes one of her dazzling smiles, but he's not sure whether she's flirting. He looks at the young man and back at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thanks for that compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a young kid from the casino...  nice kid...  bright boy. What balls  on this fuckin' kid! The next day I  fired him. Freeze frame on ACE smiling at GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER, with two-year-old AMY in a stroller, is seated on bench going through large bank vault boxes containing her jewels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY) Hey, do you want to see this one?  Daddy gave me all this jewelry because  he loves me so much. (She places a  gold bracelet on AMY's hand.) Put  your arm in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as much as they loved her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY, wearing the  bracelet) Oh, fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they didn't know what really moved  her. She holds up a necklace to the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From the viewing  room) Daddy gave me this pin when we were  dating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with Ginger happy, I was able to  concentrate on what I knew best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is talking to DON WARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loose machines are right back over  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doin' way back there?  Bring 'em up here where they belong.   You can't even see 'em over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the progressives with the  high jackpots? Where are they? These  machines are hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are our best machines. They  bring all the action. No wonder the  drop is off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The action is in the front, not in  the back. Bring 'em up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I will, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me very carefully. There  are three ways of doing things around  here. The right way, the wrong way,  and the way I do it. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do understand that. I'll get right  on it. And thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me, just do it. You're  the Slots Manager. I shouldn't have  to tell you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang, you are right, Mr Rothstein, I  am so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER follows a snooty MAITRE D' to JENNIFER, already se at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I ended up workin' what? Eighteen- hour days?  Ginger was the one who  wound up enjoying the best of Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To JENNIFER) Come with me, please. I have a better  table for you.  Sorry. He shows the two of them to the best table in the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sitting down next to

dialogues.speaker: GINGER
dialogues.text: So, what'd you say to that fuckin'  jerk anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smiling) I told him I was Mrs Sam Rothstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles) Well, you might as well get somethin'  out of it. GINGER lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide overhead of roadhouse cafe isolated in the middle of the desert with a sign out front that reads '60 miles to  Vegas'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn't long before what I  was afraid was gonna happen, happened.  Nicky managed to get himself banned  from every casino in Las Vegas, and  from then on, I couldn't be seen  talkin' to him anywhere in Vegas, or  even near it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From inside the diner) What the fuck is that supposed to  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and NICKY are seated at a table in the empty diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading from a  document) ' ...detrimental to gaming. And he  will be ejected from any casino in  Las Vegas...  and the casinos can be  fined as much as a hundred thousand  every time he shows up.' (He waves the document.) Do you believe this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smoking a cigarette) Yeah, I believe it. You got banned. NICKY hisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading) 'Who is of notorious and unsavory  reputation...' He angrily wads the document and tosses it across the tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.  Unsavory fuckin'...  Is there any way around this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, there's no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say... for instance... I want  to go in the restaurant which happens  to be in the casino... to get one of  those sandwiches I like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You can't even set foot  in the parking lot. That's how serious  it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, I'm fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In so many words, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just didn't sink into his head  about the Black Book and what it  meant. Not being able to go into a  casino is just one thing, but being  in this book etched your name into  the brains of every cop and FBI agent  in the state. I mean, you're listed  in there with Al Capone. But Nicky  didn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta do somethin'. I gotta do  somethin'. They ain't gettin' rid of  me. They're not gettin' rid of me.  I'm staying here. Fuck 'em. Fuck  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, once they pulled that shit, I  started doin' my own things in Vegas  nobody ever thought of doin'. To  keep an eye on things, I brought in  my kid brother Dominick... and some  desperadoes from back home and started  knockin' over high rollers, casino  bosses, bookmakers, anybody, right  here in town. I had a good fuckin'  crew goin' for me, I'll tell you  that. SAL FUSCO, JACK HARDY and BERNIE BLUE are getting out of car and walking into the jewelry store which is designed replicate an old-fashioned Western town with peaked roofs wooden planked sidewalks and hitching posts. The camera t by each man as they're introduced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had Sal Fusco, a great second-story  guy. Jack Hardy, he worked for a  safe company after he did a six-year  bit. And then there was Bernie Blue.  This guy could bypass any alarm for  me. And I opened up my own jewelry  store, too: 'The Gold Rush'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY places some jewelry from a vanity table into a sack and turns over some family photos. MARINO and HARDY are  struggling with a safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I used to go along on a  heist just for the fun of it. But I  didn't like the people I was rippin'  off lookin' at me, so I used to turn  their fuckin' pictures around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO and HARDY) What's takin' so long over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This peter's a motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grunting) It's workin'. Just keep workin' it.  It's comin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta learn how to open these fuckin'  things so you won't have to take  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is looking at diamonds with MARINO, HARDY and BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie, some of these stones got a  lot of niggers in 'em. ZOOM IN TIGHT ON A DIAMOND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that fuckin' Pepe if he's  switching stones on us, he'd better  take a fuckin' camel - Phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - back to (picking up phone) Nigeria. (Into telephone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Talking quietly into  telephone) ...they're in Penthouse K.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) They check in alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) They checked in alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Are they out now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yes, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Thanks. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had tipsters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see some luggage on the floor. A BELLMAN is on the pho with MARINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all over town. Bellmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) This one looks good.  But you got to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...yeah, okay. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VALET PARKER standing outside a casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valet parkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) They're just checking in now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone, seated  on a couch) Okay, I'll tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PIT BOSS is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pit bosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, room twelve-thirty, at the  Sirocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Twelve-thirty, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY seated at a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) It's all in mint condition coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Mint condition. All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY and a hood are in a van parked in front of a wareho next door to a jewelry store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...got a piece of the score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From inside the van,  into a walkie-talkie) Car's comin'. We move past the van to a larger truck parked in an alley Unseen, the truck has an open side door abutting the jewe store's wall. SAL FUSCO and BERNIE BLUE are inside the tr drilling into the wall using a heavy-duty battery-powered drill. The drill is muffled with sheets of insulation  material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were always very careful. And  they always bypassed the alarms, or  else... if not, they'd drill enough  holes to knock through the walls  with a sledgehammer... BLUE widens the hole with a hammer muffled with insulatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashbulb explodes. Cops and detectives are photographing and inspecting hole drilled in the wall of the shop, through which the thieve have come and gone. The camera moves in through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody out there was expecting a guy  like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stunned STORE OWNER looks at the rubble and the empty jewelry boxes. Detectives collect evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Nicky, Las Vegas was the fuckin'  Wild West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Leading a detective  to his showroom) I just got a shipment of diamonds  from Israel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what the fuck they expect from  me? I had to earn, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINO stands above two IRANIANS who are looking at the s gems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this diamond has flaws in  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, there's no flaws in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me. I'm doing this for  twenty-five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better clean your fuckin' loupe.  'Cause there's no flaws in these  diamonds. The two IRANIANS speak to each other in Farsi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever we got local merch, we'd  usually send it to Palm Spring or  Arizona... LA. I had a couple of  sand niggers out there. You know,  Arabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you gonna have a fuckin'  meeting here, or are you gonna buy  some diamonds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckling) No, no. I know his language. I'm  talking with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty thousand dollars, you can buy  the whole package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty thousand, and that's my final  offer and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To IRANIAN #2) All of a sudden he talks English,  now. (To IRANIAN #1.) Let's talk turkey here, how 'bout  twenty-five thousand? IRANIAN #1 laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and MARINO sneak into the house past JENNIFER who i asleep on the sofa in front of a TV set. NICKY takes out key and opens the metal door into his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually turned my bedroom into a  bank vault where I kept the choice  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Referring to JENNIFER  as they pass the  kitchen) She asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every night, on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't leave it at the Gold Rush  in case we got raided by the cops...  or if my crew got cute. Opening the metal door to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the only key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pans across bedroom to closet door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer didn't give a fuck. She  used to fall asleep on the couch  watchin' television every night.  This stuff was all mine. I didn't  send any of this back home. NICKY opens the closet door. He and MARINO walk in and be down to lift up a small square of carpet to reveal a floo safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I couldn't because I wasn't  even supposed to be doin' it. The  bosses were makin' so much fuckin'  money with the casinos (unlocking the safe) that they didn't want anybody makin'  any waves for them. In the floor safe, there are several handguns and silence FRANK hands NICKY a roll of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give all the guys in your crew a  piece of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took care of everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   He searches MARINO's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why there was no real organized  street stuff in Vegas before I came  here. NICKY throws the cash in the safe and closes the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is being shown papers by CHARLIE CLARK, a heavy-set banker with a moustache. They're both seated at a table i the living-room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that works out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how much cash could I bury in my  closet, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to understand, and I - I'm  sure you do... that in a venture of  this kind, you have to be prepared  to take some kind of loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, listen, I understand that there's  always a risk... you know, I might  have to take a loss somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I put some of the money into  legitimate deals with Charlie Clark.  He was Ace's banker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you will try to push it  through, won't you, Mr Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you gotta understand, I'm giving  you fifty thousand cash. CHARLIE CLARK chuckles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I put some more of the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prosciutto sandwich is being prepared on a kitchen coun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in some legitimate places, like  my restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COOK preparing  sandwich) Is that the last one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He hands the sandwich to DOMINICK who spits in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had my kid brother, Dominick, run  it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Spits) Fuckers! DOMINICK wraps it in plastic and puts it into a brown pap bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOMINICK sets the bag with the wrapped sandwich in it on of pizza boxes being held by two uniformed Vegas COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Thanks, a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah, enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He shakes COP #2's hand before heading back into the  restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good time. (Muttering to himself.) Choke on it, ya motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Passing DOMINICK on  his way out) Hey, Dom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doin'? DOMINICK walks over to some patrons in the bar area. NICK enters, kissing his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Nicky loved restaurants. He  was a real restaurant buff. And over  the years, he always made money with  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking at one of  the patrons) Hey, Rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Vegas, he had The Leaning Tower.  It was a very popular spot. He had  politicians, showgirls and movies  stars hangin' out all over the place. NICKY walks up to STEVE ALLEN and JAYNE MEADOWS seated at table, he whistles their theme tune as he approaches from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, that show over at the Flamingo  gets better and better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, Sammy said whenever you  have a minute, give him a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made a messenger out of you too,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Laughs) I'll do anything for a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does it. He does it to everybody.  Enjoy your dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gotta tell you, the thing Nicky  liked the most was the showgirls,  naturally. I mean, to them, Nicky  was the movie star. NICKY walks across the room to MARINO and two showgirls,  SHELLY and STACY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) You walk past me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. This is Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Shelly. (Kisses her hand.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to STACY) And this is Stacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacy. (Kisses her hand.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the SHOWGIRLS) This is Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna have dinner. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, uh, (To SHELLY) Let's just check the kitchen first.  Excuse us one second. Come on, I'll  show you. He takes SHELLY's hand and leads her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) 'Cause I fly stuff in fresh every  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and SHELLY walk across the parking lot and get into his two-tone, red and white car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get bread from back home. I get  fish from California. And you can  always tell a great kitchen like  ours because of the milk-fed veal.  That's the secret. Opening the car door from the passenger's side, she gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, milk-fed veal is pure white.  Out here, they got that pink veal.  Slide over, honey. She slides over, he gets into the passenger's seat and cl the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, pink veal, you can pound that  shit for two days and it'll never  get tender, you know what I mean? SHELLY's head disappears into NICKY's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK and DOMINICK are at the bar watching as NICKY chast AL, a gambler. The restaurant is empty except for a waite milling around in the background, setting a few tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I left here with the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I got muscled on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of guys, I owe them. So,  that's what I did. I gave 'em the  money.  That's what I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call yourself a man? You know  you're a lyin', low-life,  motherfuckin' gambling degenerate  prick? You know that's what you are?   Two small kids at home. I gave you  money to pay the fuckin' rent and  buy groceries, put the heat on. You  know your wife called Frankie and  told him the fuckin' heat's off? AL glances over to MARINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? And you didn't gamble that  fuckin' money? You're gonna stand  here and tell me that? He shakes his head 'no'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no? You didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't give 'em the m-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me, Al! Don't make a  fuck out of me! You want to embarrass  me and make a fool out of me?!  You  didn't gamble?! Tell me you gambled  the fuckin' money, I'll give you the  fuckin' money to put the fuckin'  heat on! Did you gamble?! Huh?! The chastised gambler nods 'yes', bowing his head in sham

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' degenerate, you. NICKY takes some money from his coat pocket and starts  counting out some bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' kids at home!  Here. (Giving him the money.) Get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. AL walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me find out you fucked up, I'll  leave you wherever I find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY, worn out from the night before, is making pancakes for LITTLE NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To LITTLE NICKY) How many of these you gonna eat,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But around six-thirty in the morning  when he finished his day - NICKY hugs and kisses his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - no matter where he was or what he  was doing, he always went home to  make breakfast for his son, Nicky- Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pouring some syrup  on his son's pancakes) Here, let's put a little of this on  for you. I know you like this. A  little butter, right, not a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause it clogs up your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a smart kid you are! (Kisses him.) Okay, eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINO walks through an office past a few hoods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every couple of weeks I used to send  Marino back to the bosses with a  piece of what I made.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE IN
dialogues.text: MARINO walks out of the office and through the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a big piece, but fuck them, what  did they know? They were fifteen  hundred miles away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of gas station. There is snow on the ground. Th cloudy, Midwestern skyline of warehouses and skyscrapers be seen behind the gas station sign: 'All-American Gas'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I don't know anybody who can  see that far. Their drop was a truck  stop/garage where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REMO GAGGI is seated in a chair as MARINO walks in. CURLY one of Gaggi's men, and two of the bosses are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Remo and the guys used to hang  out and count their millions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo. He bends down and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Frankie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, the cops knew, but they didn't  give a fuck. I mean, you know, they  all worked it out together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky sends his warmest regards. MARINO unzips a small sack and hands GAGGI a thick stack cash. GAGGI inspects it before handing it over to one of men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I knew how to keep the bosses  happy. Whenever they gave me little  jobs to do, you know, to send a  message, I would carry things out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how are things going down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Everything's goin' good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to a tee. Like the time Tony  Dogs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash cut of TONY DOGS and two men shooting up a bar with automatics hitting the owner, bartenders and a waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who was supposed to be the new  maniac tough guy in town, shot up  one of Remo's bars. Here's a fuckin'  guy, kills two of Remo's guys and a  poor fuckin' waitress, who was just  workin' on her night off, of all  things. SLOW MOTION ON TONY DOGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, this guy's just beggin' to  be made an example of. The men and the waitress lie dead on the floor. The bar i left in shambles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From his office) Frankie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enraged GAGGI gives MARINO orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I want all the names of all the  other people he had with him. And I  don't care what you have to do to  him to get 'em. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it, Remo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E mo va! [Italian-American slang for  'Now, go!']

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINO and BLUE are dragging TONY DOGS, who is beaten to pulp, across the floor towards a workshop table. NICKY fo them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be truthful with you, I had to  admire this fuckin' guy.  He was one  of the toughest Irishmen I ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fuckin' guy, he got some stamina,  don't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This son-of-a-bitch was tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I don't give a fuck who  was with him anyway. As long as he  gives me a name I could give to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For two days and two fuckin' nights,  we beat the shit out of this guy. I  mean, we even stuck ice-picks in his  balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better hope he gives me a fuckin'  name soon, or I'm gonna give him  yours, Frank. MARINO and BLUE lay DOGS on the table and put his head in vise. They're exhausted from beating him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY) Yeah, thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he never talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) I know you would have ratted by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the end, I had to put his fuckin'  head in a vise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs. Dogs, can your hear me, Dogs? DOGS gasps and mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Anthony. I got your  head in a fuckin' vise. I'm gonna  squash your fuckin' head like a  grapefruit if you don't give me a  name. Don't make me have to do this,  please. Come on. Don't make me be a  bad guy. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With what strength  he as left) Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO and BLUE) This motherfucker, do you believe  this? Two fuckin' days and nights! (To DOGS.) Fuck me? NICKY begins to tighten the vise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me, you motherfucker? (Turning the vise.) Fuck my mother? That's what you  fuckin' tell me? NICKY angrily keeps spinning the vise handle until sudden one of DOGS's eyes bulges out of the socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? You motherfucker, you, huh? MARINO and BLUE are horrified by the sight. Everybody fre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Give me the fuckin' name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ch-Charlie M!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie M?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Blood streaming out  of his mouth) Charlie M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Screaming) Charlie M? You make me pop your  fuckin' eye out of your head to  protect that piece of shit? Charlie  M? You dumb motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pleading) Kill me, you fuck, kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill you, (unwinds the crank) You motherfucker you! (To MARINO.) Frankie, do him a fuckin' favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word got around that finally... MARINO places a knife against DOGS's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there was a real gangster in town.  Nicky was the new boss of Las Vegas. We hear DOGS gasp as the knife slices his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie M!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extreme close-up of a slot-machine. Four reels with seven across. Suddenly, the power goes out. Lights die down..  Machine 'waaaooows' down to a dead stop. Security guards, on their hands and knees, are pulling th plugs on the three giant $15,000 progressive machines, as ACE talks to DON WARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four reels, sevens across, three  fifteen-thousand-dollar jackpots? Do  you have any idea what the odds are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, it's gotta be in the millions,  maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three fuckin' jackpots in twenty  minutes? Why didn't you pull the  machines? Why didn't you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it happened so quick. Three  guys won. I didn't have a chance to  call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't see the scam? You didn't  see what was goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's no way to determine  that, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there is. An infallible way!  They won!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a casino. People gotta  win sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Ward, you're pissin' me off.  Now, you're insulting my intelligence.  What do you think, I'm a fuckin'  idiot? You know goddamn well somebody  had to get into those machines and  set those fuckin' reels. SHERBERT enters, stands next to ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probability on one-four-reel  machine is a million and a half to  one. On three machines in a row,  it's in the billions.  It cannot  happen... would not happen, you  fuckin' momo! What's the matter with  you!  Didn't you see you were bein'  set up on the second win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really think you're -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) You - Wait! You didn't see that you  were being set up on the second win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really think you're overreacting  in this whole -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) Listen, you fuckin' yokel, I've had  it with you. I've been carryin' your  ass in this place ever since I got  here. Get your ass and get your things  and get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're firin' me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm firin' you? No, I'm not firin' (mocking WARD) I'm firin' you, you - Gives SHERBERT a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might regret this, Mr Rothstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll regret it even more if I keep  you on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the way to treat people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if you didn't know you're  bein' scammed, you're too fuckin'  dumb to keep this job. If you did  know, you were in on it. Either way,  you're out!  Get out! Go on. (To SHERBERT.) Let's go. ACE and SHERBERT walk off, WARD turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GREEN are seated having coffee and muffins in the Hawaiian lounge by the casino floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, the guy is history as far as  I'm concerned. History.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't just fire him. Webb's  his brother-in-law. He's County  Commissioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? Everybody out here with  cowboy boots is a fuckin' county  commissioner or related to a county  commissioner. I'm fuckin' sick of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his state. His uncle's Chief  Judge. His brother-in-law runs the  County Commission. I don't know how  many other relatives he's got in  town.  There's gotta be a way to  work him back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, I can understand. You're in  the finances, you're upstairs, but  you are not on the floor. I got  thousands of players. I got five  hundred dealers.  They're all lookin'  to rob me blind, twenty-four hours a  day. I have to let them know I'm  watching all the details, all the  time; that there is not one single  thing I will not catch as I am over  here. Breaks open his blueberry muffin, puts it down and points Green's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. Look at this. There's  nothin'... look how many blueberries  your muffin has and how many mine  has. Yours is falling apart. I have  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like everything else in this  place. You don't do it yourself, it  never gets done. GREEN follows ACE to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE, GREEN and the BAKER are gathered around the BAKER's  counter surrounded by muffin tins and batter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Handing the BAKER  the two muffins) From now on I want you to put an  equal amount of blueberries in each  muffin. An equal amount of blueberries  in each muffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how long that's going to  take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care how long it takes. Put  an equal amount in each muffin. ACE leaves, GREEN looks on in amazement as the BAKER hold the muffins. GREEN follows ACE out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE, seated at the kitchen table, is feeding AMY in a hig chair. The nanny is in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, honey, just a little. That  a girl, that a girl. Oh, boy, look. GINGER enters and goes to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY, who is sobbing  and mumbling) Okay, want to go with Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Giving AMY to the

dialogues.speaker: NANNY
dialogues.text: You get her?  Okay. (To ACE.) Well, I need a lot. I need more than  usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why don't you take it out of  your account? There's a lot there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I would, you know, Sam. It's  just that... well, I need more than  that. I need twenty-five thousand. She sits down at the table next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five thousand? For yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Picking up an empty  carton of milk) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need that much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's the difference? I just  need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean... you know, I gotta  ask you. That's a lot of money.   You're not asking for a box of  popcorn, you know. I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm aware of that. We don't have to  turn this into a big deal. (Getting up to the  refrigerator.) Okay? We don't have to have a fight.  It was important to me. But forget  it. Just something I wanted to do  for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's fighting? I mean, I'm, you  know, tell me what it's for. GINGER, annoyed, closes the refrigerator door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you tell me what it's for? She stirs her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? (Pause) Well, you know what? Now, I want you  to tell me. I mean, my wife comes to  me and asks me for twenty-five  thousand. I mean, what do you want?  Do you want a coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you want a coat, you got  it. You know that. It's not the money,  it's just why do you want it?  That's  all I'm askin'. Am I not entitled to  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - Sam, I've been independent my  whole life. I never had to ask anybody  for anything. Now you're making me  beg you for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' a- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) Okay? And you're embarrassing me.  Why do want to make me feel so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're askin' me for twenty-five  thousand. I'm not out to make you  feel bad. I want to just be able to  trust you. You now, it's about trust.  I have to be able to trust you with  my life. Do you understand? Can I  trust you? (She doesn't answer.) Can I trust you?... Can I trust  you?... Answer me. Can I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, so then you could tell me what  the money is for. GINGER gives him a look and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER takes about two inches of $100 bills out of a safe deposit box and slips it in an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is on a phone watching GINGER leave the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, she's leavin' the bank now.  All right, I'm gonna follow her. (He hangs up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is in a booth with LESTER DIAMOND, handing him the envelope filled with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? No, I know that  look. What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I got the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got money. That's a - That's a  good look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', Les? It's Lester,  right? Sam. Extends his hand to LESTER, who shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From my recollection, aren't you the  card shark... the golf hustler...   the pimp from Beverly Hills? LESTER gives GINGER a 'how did you fuck this up?' Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm wrong, please correct me,  'cause I never knew you to be a heist  man. (LESTER sighs.) But if you are, you know what...  here, take mine too. ACE takes some money out of his coat and puts the thick w of bills on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, take it. 'Cause you already  have hers. LESTER turns and sees two HOODS standing by the front and back doors of the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my wife. (To LESTER.) Look at me. You did know that, didn't  you? You knew that she's my wife?  Huh? Hey, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Yeah? Well, if you ever come  back again... ever... to take her  money... next time bring a pistol.   That way you got a chance. Be a man,  don't be a fuckin' pimp. Now, you  want to do me a favor? Get out of  here. I want to be alone with my  wife. Get the fuck up and get out of  here.
