After stammering for a moment, LESTER gets up and begins move towards the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's just fuckin' - That's  bullshit. You know, you know, what  the fuck? The thugs follow him out of the back door. GINGER freezes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember when you called him  that night? When you said goodbye to  him?  He didn't say, 'Don't get  married, I'll be right down, we'll  get married.'  He didn't say that to  you, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) No, he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Picks up the money) Didn't. No, instead, what did he  say? 'Fuck him. Take him for  everything he's got.' ACE takes GINGER by the arm to the rear of the diner wher they can see the parking area through a glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, I want to show you  somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three HOODS rush LESTER who is running towards his car. G bursts through the doors, trying to get to LESTER. ACE ho her back. They struggle. LESTER groans and gasps as the H start to beat him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No! Don't! ACE restrains her. The HOODS punch LESTER in the face and stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make them stop it! (Sobbing.) No! No! No! It's not his fault! It's  my fault! NICKY watches from a car in a parking lot across the stre out of GINGER's sight. ACE forces GINGER into the car as the HOODS finish the  beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) No! No! The HOODS toss LESTER into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Falling into the  front seat on his  back.) Fuck! NICKY watches as the HOODS walk away from LESTER's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piece of shit. ACE pulls out of the parking lot with a wailing GINGER. LESTER groans, trying to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As ACE and GINGER  drive off down the  street) Couldn't do it yourself, you  chickenshit cocksucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and NICKY are in the back room. NICKY is sitting o couch while GINGER stands by a mirror with a curling iron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Throwing the iron on  the counter) He's such a prick. He had some guy  from the hotel beat him up. He didn't  want to do it himself. Oh, no, he  didn't want to get his own hands  dirty. She takes a pill with a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why'd he have to do that, huh? She walks towards NICKY, who is sitting on a couch across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it wasn't a nice thing to do  but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) Yeah, no shit. She sits down next to NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you gotta understand it. He  doesn't know if this guy is shaking  you down or taking advantage of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! I told him all about the guy  before we ever got married. This is  no fuckin' surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you did? I didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's just a friend of mine I  was trying to help, so... so what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... the first time I ever  saw your guys together... I never  saw him so happy. I mean, I know  he's a crazy Jew fuck and everything,  but... She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never see - You know, I never seen  him act like that with anybody else.   I think he's crazy about you. I mean,  he really loves you. He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. I went into this with  my eyes open, you know. I knew the  bottom could drop out at any time.  I'm a working girl, right?  You don't  think I'm gonna go into a situation  like this if I don't think I'm gonna  get covered on the back end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he put aside some jewelry for  me. A lot of jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like a lot of expensive  jewelry? About how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, you want to steal it? (Cracking a smile.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I - I'm just curious, you know.  I was wonderin' how much he would  put into a thing like that. That's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm told it's worth about a million  dollars, maybe more.  (Sniffs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there you go. But what does  that tell ya? A million dollars in  jewelry. Does that tell you the guy  is crazy about you, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have never married him.  He's a Gemini. A triple Gemini...   duality. (Breaking down.) Gemini's the snake. You know you  can't trust the snake. (Sniffs.) I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. He moves closer to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Ginger... you know, this is  probably not... I don't have the  answers anyway... and this is probably  not what you want to hear right now,  because you're a little upset with  Ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that. But, you know, I  think you should try to make the  best of it now. Go slow, you know.  See what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could have killed him! Okay? He  could have killed him.  She gets up and walks to the counter by the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have to hit him. It's not  exactly like I'm sleepin' with the  guy! And he makes me sneak around to  see my own friends! What the fuck is  that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess it's 'cause he loves  you so much. He's jealous and worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs, her voice  starts to crack) He gives a fuck what I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting up) Look, I'll try to find out what the  hell's goin' on. When I see him I'll  talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (Walking over to him,  smiling.) Thanks. Towering over NICKY, holding a drink in one hand and his  shoulder in the other, she leans down and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for puttin' up with me. NICKY takes the drink out of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take it easy with this shit,  will you? I mean, this can only make  matters worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a beautiful girl. You don't  want to ruin your looks. I've seen a  lot of girls get shot to hell from  this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Fidgeting with his  jacket, then holding  his face in her hands,  smiling.) You're so nice. (She begins to cry.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, now, I don't want to see  you unhappy. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tenderly strokes his  head) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She embraces NICKY, wrapping her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through tears) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Feeling a little  awkward with the hug) It's all right. She kisses him again. NICKY doesn't move, holding back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back from a sign, with a tiny 'yes' on top of a giga 'no', leaning on a window overlooking the sportsbook. We ACE, behind his desk, taking a swig of Mylanta. His SECRE telephones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see past PAT WEBB's cowboy hat down onto Ace's SECRETA on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Mr Rothstein? County Commissioner  Pat Webb is here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Okay. ACE hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To WEBB) It'll just be a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE gets up from his desk and we see he is in his boxer  shorts. He opens the closet and carefully puts on the tro hanging inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very patient WEBB is leaning against some double doors  across from Ace's SECRETARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Webb...  Can I get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. (Cordially tipping  his hat.) No, thank you, little lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Okay, send him in and call me four  minutes after. WEBB walks in. He is big, tough and western, wearing a  Stetson, tooled boots, jeans, an elbow-patched jacket and turquoise bear claw string-tie. His headband contains a  rattlesnake head. Ace's SECRETARY shuts the door on her w out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein... (With hand outstretched  to ACE.) I'm Pat Webb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do? They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it is my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard a lot about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you, sir. Looking out Ace's office picture window overlooking the  sportsbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, house is doin' well. (Chuckling.) Hey, all that money is rollin' in. I  appreciate you takin' the time to  see a poor ol' civil servant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's quite all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you have a seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? Oh. Thank you, sir. WEBB sits down in a chair in front of ACE's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I come here personally to kind  of smooth over a fracas about a  certain matter. See, uh, maybe you  didn't know it, but, uh, Don Ward is  a very well-liked man in this town.   He's got lots of friends here. Now,  his family and their money go back  many, many years. Now, friends vote...  family and money votes. That's  important to me... and you. And if  you'll think about our little problem  along them lines...  and you forgive  me for sayin' it, maybe he did not  deserve to be fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but he knew about our  gettin' hit on three big machines in  a row and he did nothing about it.   That means either he was in on it  or, forgive me for saying this, he  was too dumb to see what was going  on. Either way, I cannot have a man  like that workin' here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we point the dirty end of the  stick at 'ol Don, uh, we better be  sure we can prove them charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, if I could prove it, he  would be under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are, uh - (Clears throat.) - are we certain that you want the  Gamin' Control Board eyeballin' your  record and your gangster pals like  Nicky Santoro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're way out of line talkin'  to me like that. What you're sayin'  is libelous, and you're in no position  to challenge my expertise. I went  way out of my way to be very helpful  and courteous to that kid. He's weak,  he's incompetent. He jeopardizes the  whole place. There's not much more I  can do for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckling) You have got me there. Old Don is as  useless as tits on a boar. (Chuckles.) But, he is my brother-in-law, and I  would look on it as a personal favor  if you'd think some more on hirin'  him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. And I appreciate  the fact that he's your brother-in- law, and I do want to help you and I  like to do favors, and I know who  you are, but I cannot do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, could there be any position...  further down the trough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause) I'm sorry, I can't do anything. He's  too incompetent. And the bottom line  is, he cannot be trusted. The telephone rings. ACE picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Okay, thanks. (To WEBB.) Um... you know, that's it. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein. Your people never will  understand the way it works out here.  You're all just our guests. But you  act like you're at home. Let me tell  you somethin', partner... you ain't  home. But that's where we're gonna  send you if it harelips the Governor. (Pause.) Thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. (Getting up and shaking  hands.) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smiles slightly) You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE, in pain from his ulcer, opens a bottle of pills in h bathroom and sees that it is almost empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my pills? He leaves the bathroom and walks into the bedroom where G is stretched out on their imperial bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Waving the pill bottle) Isn't it bad enough you're drinkin'  too much, you're takin' all my pills  too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't take your pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - for my ulcer, I take a half a  one of these, a half a one of these.   And that's when I have extreme pain.  I had a three-month supply. What'd  you do with 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) You didn't have to beat him up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walking back to the  bathroom) What? ACE puts the bottle into the medicine cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) I was just tryin' to help him. It's  not like I'm sleeping with the guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how do I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) You can't make me stop caring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, you can't make me stop caring  about people. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Trying to calm her) Listen. (Stepping up to the  bed.) Ginger. I'm tryin' to make the best  of everything here, you know?  I  mean, you're my wife, for chrissakes.  Uh, I mean... people look up to you  in this town. I don't know what to  think -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) You know what, Ace? I don't give a  shit! I'm gettin' out of here. (Crying.) I am. She sits up woozy, and tries to pull on her trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walking around the  bed to her) It's okay.  Look... (holding her face,  gently) ...you gotta get a hold of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If not for me, at least for Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gently) You understand? Your drinking's  gettin' way out of hand. I'm gonna  get you into a program. They got  plenty of good ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do. It's very discreet.  There's no names in the papers. You  don't have to worry about any of  that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you care about. (Collapsing on the  edge of the bed.) You don't care about me at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Bending down to her) Yes, I - yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you say that?  You're a  beautiful woman. You're destroying  yourself. You don't need that stuff.  You don't need that fuckin' leech  livin' off you. I know you better  than you know yourself. You're a  tiger, you're stronger than I am.   And when you set your mind on doing  something, you do it better than  anybody. (Strokes her hair.  Then, quietly:) You can do it. (Kissing her.) You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) Oh, God. Oh, God. Okay.  Okay...  I'll try. I'll try. She sits up and puts her arms around ACE's waist. He stro her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try. I will. Don't be mad at  me, okay... I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move in on a door that reads: 'Notice - No Admittance -  Caution - Hearing Protection Must Be Worn In This Area'.  NANCE opens it with a key to reveal the hard count room.  Coins tumble of a conveyor belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what the problems were  outside the count room, it was all  worth it. The cash kept rollin' in.  And the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE, dumping two large suitcases in the trunk of a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...suitcases kept comin' and goin'.  And let me tell ya, the fuckin' bottom  line here is... cash. The trunk lid is shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counters sort through a pile of cash on a table. The  camera moves on one counter as he pockets some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only problem was that, after a  while, the bosses noticed that the  suitcases were gettin' a little light. FREEZE FRAME ON THE COUNTER POCKETING A $100 BILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE is seated at a table eating with FORLANO, CAPELLI,  CAPP, BORELLI, PISCANO and GAGGI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspett'. [Italian-American slang for  'Wait'] Wait a minute. You mean to  tell me that the money we're robbing  is bein' robbed? That somebody's  robbing from us?  We go through all  this fuckin' trouble, and somebody's  robbin' us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NANCE) Eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, you know, i-it's part  of the business. I-it's considered  leakage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leakage, my balls. I want the guy  who's robbin' us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE enters through a door and walks past a man picking a bucket of coins and dumping them into a trough. A clerk seated at a coin weighing scale, places a ticket into a s tray. NANCE reads the printout of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even John Nance, that's the guy who  ran the skim, he knew there wasn't  much you could do about it. You gotta  know that a guy who helps you steal,  even if you take care of him real  well, I mean, he's gonna steal a  little bit extra for himself. Makes  sense, don't it? Right? Well, you go  try and make these hard-headed old  greaseballs understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of skimming if we're  being skimmed? Defeats the whole  purpose of what we're doin' out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NANCE) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they take this money because  they're my guys. So you gotta give  'em some leeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the bosses never believed in  leeway, so listen to what they do:  they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BORELLI is talking to PISCANO, his underboss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...put Artie Piscano, the underboss  of KC, in charge of making sure nobody  skimmed the skim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell have you been doin'  out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was out there with my cumma [Italian- American slang for 'girlfriend'.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cumma? What are you doin' with  your cumma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else? I gave her a schaff  [Italian-American slang for 'tap'.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only trouble was, Piscano was a  disaster. This guy could fuck up a  cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie, what the hell have you been  doin' out there, Artie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out there more than I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And little did anybody know where  this would all lead. If they did,  they would have been better off makin'  fuckin' novenas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go back there and talk to  that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, go back there? I never got  paid my expenses for the last trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What expenses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm goin' all over, layin'  money out of my own pocket, and I  never get anything back. What the  hell's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go back out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, from now on, I'm gonna  start keepin' records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie, no records, Artie. What are  you gonna do with records? Pay taxes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I keep layin' out my own fuckin'  dough for these trips and nothin'  ever comes back. I mean, what hell's  goin' on? What are we doin' over  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goin' out to Las Vegas, you're  havin' a good time at my expense.  What the fuck? I mean, after all,  you're the one having a good time,  not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how many novenas you could  make, nothin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN is arguing with ANNA SCOTT, a fifty-year-old no-non businesswoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...was gonna stop what came up next  at the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made a deal. You came to me,  remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I appreciated your advice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turned out Phil Green, Mr  Integrity, had a partner nobody knew  about... and when she showed up and  started demanding some money from  the Tangiers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I am not wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Green tried to stonewall her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not going to get away  with this! I will see to it that you  do not get away with this! She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JUDGE is seated at his bench. SCOTT and GREEN, surround by their lawyers, take their seats. NANCE watches from th back row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she sued him in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The court will now hear the matter  of the plaintiff, Anna Scott, against  Tangiers Corporation and its  president, Philip Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, your Honor. John Momet  on behalf of Mr Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell Logan on behalf of Anna  Scott, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Logan, you may proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Judge. As the JUDGE pounds his gavel, we see ANNA SCOTT and a gr GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA SCOTT holds an impromptu press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe he was absolutely fair and  I'm delighted with the decision. NANCE is talking at a pay phone, SCOTT and the reporters in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: HOME
dialogues.text: CURLY hands GAGGI the phone. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) It didn't go too well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As GREEN and his  lawyers walk past  him, exiting the  court-house) Green has to open up the books...  has to show how he got the financing.  And, hey, that's - that's not good.

dialogues.speaker: HOME
dialogues.text: GAGGI, holding a cigarette, snaps his fingers in disgust, grunts, and slams down the phone. He men watch in silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. CURLY takes the phone away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was doin' pretty good with her  lawsuit, but before she could start  countin' her money, the boys back  home decided to settle the case out  of court instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTT, alone, is sitting at her kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, they send me. NICKY swiftly enters the room, grabs SCOTT around the nec and fires three shots into her head. He leans SCOTT back against the chair, then gently, while stroking her hair, sets her head to the side. Blood flows from her mouth on to her pink robe. NICKY grabs his gun and leaves. Reporters are heard shouting 'Mr Green'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN gets off the Tangiers corporate jet and is assaulte by questions about the Scott murder. GREEN is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you comment on the murder of  Anna Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was found last night, shot in  the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this just a real-estate  partnership?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her lawyer said you were partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were - We were involved in minor  real estate deals many years ago.   It was never a partnership. Reporters chase CHASE as he walks down the ramp and acros the tarmac to his white limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are calling this a mob-style  killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever hear of the twenty-two- caliber killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little in shock, quite  frankly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, instead of the cops only lookin'  at Nicky, they started looking at  Green too. And he was supposed to be  our squeaky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is being interviewed by a female Business Week REPORT SHERBERT and RONNIE are sitting on a couch, listening to interview. The REPORTER is seated across from ACE, at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...clean front man. So, I had to  start giving interviews to make sure  everybody knew the casino was on the  up and up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, actually, how often do you really  fill in for him? ACE looks at SHERBERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to REPORTER, who  looks his way.) Green's here about two or three times  a month, and he's busy - (REPORTER glances  back at ACE.) - with other real-estate deals and -  and things, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) So, in Green's absence, then, you're  the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I serve at the pleasure of the  chairman of the board and... my, uh,  responsibilities are to run the day- to-day operations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, day-to-day, then, you're the  boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in a sense, you could say  that... I am the boss, when Mr Green  is away. You could say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magazine headline reads 'Sam Rothstein: "I'm the Boss!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. Have you read this? The magazine shows a photograph of ACE. A caption reads:  'Rothstein asserts authority at Tangiers Casino'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? It's 'bout Mr Rothstein. We see WEBB holding up a copy of Business Week in the gam board office of investigators RONNIE DUPREY and MATT AUST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says (Reading) 'The Midwest bookmaker with mob ties  says that he is the real boss of the  new hundred-million-dollar Tangiers  Casino empire.' (To DUPREY and AUSTIN) You believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he really say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, of course, he really said that.  It's right here. Has that man even  filed for his license yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'll have to check  the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, without gettin' your shorts in  a knot, would you do that? And kinda  check closely, 'cause we may have to  kick a kike's ass out of town.  Thank  you. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is watching the television news which features his ph and a police photo of NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On television) A Gaming Control Board investigation  of Tangiers executive Sam Rothstein's  application for a (photo of ACE)  gaming license is underway. Rothstein,  who heads the Tangiers Casino  operation and is a boyhood friend of  Las Vegas mob boss Nicky Santoro, (photo of NICKY) Could lose his ability to work in  the casino. The phone rings. It's NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see NICKY through the telephone booth glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...I gotta meet Clean Face right  away. What about the Chez Paree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I gotta meet Charlie the Banker  right away at your house, okay?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) No, you, you can't. You gotta make a  reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) It's all booked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I don't want a meeting at my house.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No, no it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) It's impossible. It's booked up, and  you gotta make a reservation.  It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...very difficult to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Well, it's okay. I'll use the service  entrance. I'll see you at nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I'll come in from the golf course  side. See you at six.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...all right. He hangs up and takes a drag off his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On television, from  following scene) The battle between...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and the banker, CHARLIE CLARK, are upstairs in the de which has a patio overlooking a swimming pool and golf co CHARLIE is seated on a couch watching TV. GINGER enters a walks across the room, getting another drink from the bar ACE, taking his ulcer medicine, watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On television) ...state gaming officials and Tangiers  Casino boss Sam 'Ace' Rothstein is  heating up. Tonight, an up-to-the- minute look at Ace Rothstein's attempt  to get state licensing despite law  enforcement allegations of Rothstein's  organized crime connections. Will  Sam Rothstein's friendship with  alleged organized crime figure Nicky  Santoro keep Rothstein from running  the Tangiers Casino?  And can the  integrity of state gaming laws be  jeopardized by a boyhood friendship? ACE walks over to GINGER at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Why don't you take it easy with that  stuff? Huh?  Come on. Let me help  you. Come on. We're talkin' about  some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On television) State officials say 'yes' when that  relationship and those connections  are with anyone as notorious as Nicky  Santoro. ACE takes GINGER's arm and leads her out of the room towa the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight at six: 'Will a boyhood  friendship unseat Rothstein as the  Tangiers' Casino boss?' Exclusive on  the KVVO Special News Report. (Reading commercial.) ...Promise to keep my money fears  away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To GINGER) Just go downstairs.  Just... go downst- She struggles to break away from his firm grip, gives him look and starts to walk down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On television,  continuing commercial) Promise to be financially secure?  Money Time can help you keep those  promises. ACE looks down on GINGER as she slips on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let this concern you, Ace.  Don't worry about that stuff. Outside the glass door NICKY arrives via the stairs from golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a political witch hunt. ACE opens the sliding glass door and NICKY enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. NICKY walks over to CHARLIE CLARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want something to drink? Charlie you  want a refill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, refill'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Approaching CHARLIE) No, I don't want one. (Smiling, extends his  hand.) Hey, Mr Clark, how you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shaking hands) Hi. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sitting down with  him on a couch) I've been trying to reach you. You're tougher to get than the  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've been busy. (Chuckles.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, least you could do is return  my phone calls, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... Nicky... we talked about  this... and, uh, I explained to you  that there was the possibility you  might have to take some kind of loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (Pause.) I think I want my money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckling) What're you gonna do? Strong-arm me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I think that you've gotten  the wrong impression about me. I  think in all fairness, I should  explain to you what it is that I do.  For instance, tomorrow morning I'll  get up nice and early, take a walk  down over to the bank and walk in  and see you, and, uh... if you don't  have my money for me, I'll crack  your fuckin' head wide open in front  of everybody in the the bank. And  just about the time that I'm comin'  out of jail, hopefully, you'll be  comin' out of your coma. And guess  what?  I'll split your fuckin' head  open again. Because I'm fuckin'  stupid. I don't give a fuck about  jail.  That's my business. That's  what I do. And we know what you do,  don't we, Charlie? You fuck people  out of money and get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As he puts a notepad  in his briefcase) You can't talk to me like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grabbing CHARLIE by  his jacket) Hey, you fat Irish prick. You put my  fuckin' money to sleep. You go get  my money, or I'll put your fuckin'  brain to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE, panting) Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind fuckin' Sam. This is  personal. (Walking with CHARLIE  to the stairs.) I'll be there in the morning. You  can fuckin' try me, fatso. A frightened CHARLIE hurries down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' try me. He turns to ACE who's behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he got the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walking to NICKY) What're you doin'? He's a square  guy, for chrissakes.  You can't treat  him like that. He's gonna run to the  FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the FBI! That prick's been  dodging me for three weeks. And what  is it with you?  All of a sudden,  you're tryin' to tell me what to do  all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not tryin' to tell you what to  do. But you were way out of line,  Nick. What're you doin'? Where's  your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my head? Where's your fuckin'  balls? Huh? You know I'm tryin' to  put somethin' really big together  out here. You know what I'm talkin'  about, huh? You know!  If you're  actin' like this now, how can I depend  on you?  There's a lot of things  gonna change out here. And if you  wanna be there with me, Sammy, you're  gonna have to go my fuckin' way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Nick, you gotta understand  my situation. I'm responsible for  thousands of people. I got a hundred  million a year goin' through the  place.  It's all over, I'm gonna  tell you, it's all over, if I don't  get that license.  And believe me,  if it goes bad for me, it's gonna go  bad for a lot of people, you  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, forget about your fuckin'  license. I plant my own flag out  here, you ain't gonna need a fuckin'  license. (Pause.) You know, I don't know what it is,  Sammy, but the more I talk to you,  the more I feel like you just don't  wanna go along with me, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't wanna come -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna come along with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be honest with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna be involved in anything  you're talkin' about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. NICKY walks to a table and flips through Business Week  magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...okay? I just wanna run a square  joint. That's it. I just want my  license. I want everything nice and  quiet. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Holding up the  magazine) You mean, quiet like this: 'I'm the  boss.'  That's quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all taken out of context.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's out of context. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no control over that. Ronnie  and Billy were right there. They'll  tell you exactly what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, back home they don't know about  fuckin' control. That looks bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks bad? I'm gonna tell you what  looks bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time you're on television I  get mentioned. That looks bad. That  looks bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to you? Will  you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to me? What happened  to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost your control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you lost your control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. You're fuckin' walkin'  around like John Barrymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fuckin' pink robe and a fuckin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...uh, uh, cigarette holder. I'm - I  lost control?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I didn't want to bring  this up, but you have treating a lot  of people with a lot of disrespect.  Even your own wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, what does she have to do with  all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she comes to see me. She was  upset about a lot of things,  especially that whole fuckin' Diamond -  that Lester Diamond incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden, you're the shoulder  to cry on? Did you at least tell her  about your little role in that whole  situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. What good would that  do? That's not the fuckin' point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I would -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) The point is that she's upset. She's -  and you got a fuckin' problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - I would appreciate it if you'd  stay out of my personal life, okay?   You wouldn't like it if I did it to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she came to talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't do it to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came to talk to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I - what was I supposed to do,  throw her out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ju-just stay away from her. It's  none of your business, okay? There  are certain things you don't do, and  you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of my business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week ago it was my business, now  it's none of my business. In other  words, when you need me to take care  of somethin' for you, then you need  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right, the way you need  me to vouch for you as a citizen and  get you out of one of your jams. I'm  gonna have to straighten out what  you just did with this guy. NICKY starts to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy is gonna run to the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fuckin' head is getting' bigger  than your casino. That's your problem,  pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew what he wanted, and I didn't  want any part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walking to the glass  doors leaving ACE  standing there) Fuckin' walking around with a big  head. You better check yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky wanted to take over. He wanted  to go after Gaggi, go after the skim,  go after everything and everybody. NICKY shuts the door behind him and walks down the stairs the golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, he had stopped askin' permission  from back home for every little thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A casino boss and his wife were  killed. The bulls questioned Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police photographers taking pictures of a dealer, dead be the wheel of his car, his eyes and mouth frozen wide open a silent scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dealer from the Sirocco... they  questioned Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two policemen open the trunk of a car and find a trussed- dead body. They cover their noses because of the stench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of stool pigeons wound in  the trunks of their cars... they  questioned Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a brand-new car explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lawyer... they questioned Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A front door where a pile of newspapers have accumulated. Another newspaper is thrown at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when some guys who didn't pay  their Shylocks began disappearing,  Nicky's name was in every one of  those newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and OSCAR GOODMAN, his lawyer, leave the court-hous surrounded by reporters and photographers. They wait at t curb for the light and NICKY, smiling, politely cautions photographer to be careful of the on-coming traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky was questioned in two dozen  murders, but they always had to let  him go. There were never any  witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coppers blamed me for everything  that went wrong out here, and I mean  every little fuckin' thing too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To photographer) Watch yourself. You're gonna get  runned over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a guy fuckin' tripped over a  fuckin' banana peel, they'd bring me  in for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To reporters) Come on, huh. That's enough now. Be  nice, huh? Be nice.

dialogues.speaker: HOME
dialogues.text: MARINO walks through a doorway to GAGGI's office. CURLY p him on the back. He shakes BEEPER's hand, then FORLANO's, who is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bosses were no better. I  mean, they complained day and night  because things don't run smooth.  Well, in my line of work, things  don't run so smooth, I'm sorry. I  mean, I'm dealing with degenerate  animals out here. But the bosses,  what do they give a fuck? They're  sittin' on their asses, drinkin'  anisette. Meanwhile, I'm the guy in  the trenches. Fuckin' bosses, they  think it's a fuckin' free lunch out  here. MARINO hands a brown-paper bag filled with $100 bills to  GAGGI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ignoring the money) Frankie... they found a guy's head  in the desert. Do you know about  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everybody's talkin' about it.  They're makin' a big deal out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in all the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I mean... that's no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta tell him... to take care  of things a little better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him, Remo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is talking quietly to MARINO. They are surrounded b people waiting for the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bosses. I mean, they're smokin'  their Di Nobilis and they're eatin'  a trippa [Italian-American slang for  'tripe'.] and fuckin' suffritt', you  know, fried pigs guts? While, if I  wanna talk private, I gotta go to a  fuckin' bus stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) But, hey, what do they care, as long  as I keep sendin' money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they're complaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em complain. I'm the one who's  here. The bus arrives, obscuring our view of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do all the work. Somebody don't  like it, fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want a fuckin' war, I'm ready. When the bus departs it reveals NICKY and MARINO alone on the bench, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know one thing. All I gotta do is  take care of four or five of those  fuckin' guys, the rest will fall  right into place. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is watching a police surveillance car with two agen through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peekaboo, you fucks, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you, you motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem was, Nicky was not only  bringin' heat on himself, but on me  too. The FBI watched every move he  made. But he didn't care. He just  didn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're gonna watch me, fuck 'em,  I'm gonna watch 'em right back. I  spent a few dollars. Top dollar, who  gives a shit? HARDY, seated next to MARINO, is adjusting a knob on one the may police radio scanners. There are a couple of came on the table next to him. A debugging expert is going over the walls with a metal  detector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the latest anti-buggin'  equipment from the same places that  sell to the fuckin' CIA. I had all  the special police frequency radios,  FBI descramblers, cameras that see  in the dark, and because of that,  the miserable sons-of-bitches that  they are, they never once caught me  doin' anything I couldn't handle. DOMINICK and FUSCO are at a table arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my job...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: NICKY swings a gold club. MARINO, and two men, are with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on the line and this guy's out  havin' the time of his life. He has  every cop in the state watchin' him,  and he's out playin' golf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Practice enough this week, you prick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is with the Control Board investigators AUSTIN and DU They are all pouring over legal files and record books ou on a table by the swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...worst possible time for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A record of the arrests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had my license hearing coming up  and I didn't wanna leave anything to  chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was nineteen years ago, and  they were simple gambling pinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if I can't work in Vegas,  where am I gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been very open with us. I  mean, uh, your books and papers and...   that - that's gonna mean something  when you go before the Commission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's all I ask, gentlemen, a  fair hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this kind of honesty will  guarantee that fair hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, well, we'll move on to - Suddenly a sputtering airplane flies right over Ace's hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As he looks at the  plane) I wanted to hear something about...   Kansas City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking at the  airplane) What the fuck is this? Where's this  fuckin' guy gonna land, on the  fairway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and the board investigators follow the plane as it la on the fairway. ACE has taken off his sunglasses to get a better look. Two men in suits get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) They're fuckin' agents, Frankie.  Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AGENTS run across the golf course, past ACE and the  investigators, who look on open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds were watchin' Nicky play  golf for so long, they ran out of  gas. Just what I needed. Right in  front on the Control Board. The agents run behind the hedges by ACE's pool. AUSTIN an DUPREY stare at ACE as if he had something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred dollars, whoever hits the  plane. NICKY, MARINO, and the other men swing their clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his sunglasses  back on) And, as if things weren't bad  enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in comes Piscano, the Kansas City  underboss. He ran that little grocery  store in Kansas City where they  brought the suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PISCANO and his MOTHER are at the counter of his elderly  BROTHER-IN-LAW's store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fightin' over those suitcases  again. You know what that means,  right? You know what that means,  right? That means I gotta take another  trip out to Vegas, and it's gonna  cost me another couple of grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran it with his brother-in-law,  but mostly what he did was complain,  complain about his trips to Vegas,  to his brother-in-law and to his  mother, all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Seated) You gotta lay down the law. Otherwise  they're gonna make a fool out of  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not gonna make a fool out of  me. I write it all down in this book, (holding up a notepad) every fuckin' nickel that goes down.  Right here, receipts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chastising her son) Hey! Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Receipts and bills and... everything's  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you talk like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of people here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance gives me trouble and I'll tell  him... screw around with those  suitcases and I'll take the eyes out  of his frickin' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't curse. I said 'frickin'  head'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't believe it. I mean, who  the hell would believe that the FBI  had a wire in the place lookin' for  some information about some old  homicide about some guy who was  whacked-out, God knows when, over  God knows what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, what's to prevent him with the  suitcases, that he can take what he  wants?  Fuckin' Nance, he brings us  back two suitcases from the Tangiers,  and what about three or four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pen write 'NANCE' on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got nobody in the room to watch.  That's the law. You know, we can't  even go into the count room to watch  our money? Could you believe this  cowboy bullshit? His MOTHER shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sure he's got his people in there.  But how do you know? They could all  be in on it together, those miserable  fucks. His MOTHER reacts to his language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find out and, if it's Green  himself, I'll bury that bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pen writes the word 'GREEN'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over transmitter) I've never trusted him. And you know  I got eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...behind my head. They trust that  scumbag, I don't. Right now, the way  I feel, I'll hit the two of them in  the head with a fuckin' shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, take it easy now, take it  easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm sorry, they're beatin' me  left and right. (Knocking down some  bottles of olive  oil.) Ma, I'm sorry. I'm all upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tapping the counter) I know, but that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know - You know - You know what  they're doin' to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take this no more. Back and  forth, back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. But I - I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get a heart attack like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I - I'm too upset right  now. And - An end has to be put to  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thing is, they go and hear all  this stuff about Las Vegas and the casinos and the suitcases, and that's  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have to start handlin' things  the way I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind a window overlooking the grocery store are two FBI agents listening to Piscano's conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over transmitter) ...did years ago, start kickin' ass,  I - I'll do it, and I'll use the  goddamn shovel!  I mean, I... We see an agent looking out of the window with a pair of  binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over transmitter) You are right. The other agent, with headphones, is seated at a desk by tape recorder, writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over transmitter) ...everything's comin' out of my  pocket. I gotta pay for all these  trips back and forth, back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over transmitter) You are right. What can I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) ...tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you believe that such a thing  could happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) I'm in this to make money, not to  lose money.  And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every FBI man across the country had  their ears open now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) Because... The stenographer's pen writes: 'BORELLI' on a piece of pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) ...if you want somethin'... Stenographer writes: 'TANGIERS'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) ...done right, you gotta do it  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) Then do it the way you want. Pen writes: 'VEGAS'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) What can I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... Pen writes: 'SANTORO'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Piscano, this guy basically... The stenographer's pen taps twice on the word 'SANTORO'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sunk the whole world. Pen writes: 'SANTORO'. FOCUS ON STENOGRAPHER, LISTENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On tape recorder) That's the way people are. There are  some that are good and some that are  bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is in the court with OSCAR GOODMAN, his lawyer, facin the Control Board's Chairman and six COMMISSIONER MEMBERS The Chairman is the SENATOR we saw earlier in the casino  suite taking chips out of the bureau drawer. The room is packed: GREEN, GINGER, SHERBERT, as well as WEBB, reporte and other spectators. ACE's secretaries carry in legal pa There are piles of briefs and law books on OSCAR's and AC table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Chairman and members of the  Commission. Mr Rothstein is pleased  to be here today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the day finally came, I was  ready. I felt so confident that all  I had to do was present my case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...evidence... and we have documents,  one of which is a report by retired  FBI agents, which completely absolves (holding up a large  file folder) Mr Rothstein from any wrongdoing.  I'd like this marked, please, Mr  Chairman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Pardon me, counselor. Before you  continue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to have this marked, Mr. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) ...this, uh, this Commission is  prepared to act on a motion denying  the Rothstein application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Do I hear a motion seconded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Mr. Chairman, I second the motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Do I have a vote on the motion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman - The COMMISSIONERS quickly repeat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) The ayes have it. This hearing is  adjourned. The CHAIRMAN bangs his gavel and prepares to leave. The  COMMISSIONERS hurriedly pack up their papers. An enraged rises and approaches the SENATOR.  TV CAMERAS ROLL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting up) You guys have to be kidding. The SENATOR picks up his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adjourned! What do you mean,  adjourned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman... The SENATOR picks up his folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, you promised me a hearing. We see WEBB seated in the first row, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't allow me a hearing? You  didn't even look at the FBI reports. A reporter holds a microphone up to the SENATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were my guest, Mr. Chairman,  Senator, at the Tangiers Hotel, did  you not promise me that I would have  a fair hearing - The SENATOR bends down to a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting, into  microphone) I was never - I was never your guest  at the Tangiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were never my guest?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never comped you?! I don't comp  you at least two or three times a  month at the Tangiers?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Uh, I - I'd... I'd like to answer -  answer that at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Mr Rothstein is being very typical  to this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying. WEBB starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only time I was at the Tangiers  was when I had dinner with Barney  Greenstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I at that dinner? Just tell me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wandering around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I at that dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wandering around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I at that dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wandering around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I at that dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the m- You were in the  building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the building! GREEN, embarrassed by ACE's behaviour, starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well I was at that  dinner, and you swore to me that I  would have a fair hearing at that  dinner! Did you not?! Did you not?! (Pause, ACE looks at

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR.
dialogues.text: Well, tell me I was at least at the  dinner! A-allow me that much. (Pause.) Give me that much at least!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hesitates) Yes, you were. The SENATOR starts to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks for not callin' me a  liar. You son-of-a-bitch. You son-of- a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, everyone, I'm Paige  Novodor. (On television.) What should have been a routine  licensing hearing turned into bedlam  yesterday when the flamboyant Tangiers  Casino executive, Sam ACE spots COMMISSIONER CARTER slipping out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) ...'Ace' Rothstein, accused the  state's top gaming officials of  corruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) What are you running for, Bob? What  are you running for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) ...and hypocrisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into two reporters'  microphones) Don't you remember? You promised me  a fair hearing when you were gettin'  comped at my hotel and you were asking  me for copies of your bills so - SHERBERT and GINGER look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - you could put 'em on your expense  account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a (on television) Wild and unprecedented outburst that  followed his gaming license (voice-over,  overlapping) denial, Rothstein followed several...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With several  reporters, overlapping) Bullshit! Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Putting on his sunglasses, ACE emerges from the courtroom with SHERBERT, GINGER, OSCAR and several reporters. He is surrounded by the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stunned commissioners into the  hallway, where he continued his  harangue until his own lawyers and  friends urged him to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COMMISSIONERS  standing in the  hallway, speaking  into a TV news  microphone) We all have a past. You have a past,  I have a past. And my past is no  worse than yours. But you guys think  you have the right to pass judgement  on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) Long suspected of running the Tangiers  without...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) ...twenty years in order to find  nothin' on me - OSCAR pulls him away, ACE looks back at the COMMISSIONERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - unsubstantiated truths on me. And  if you look at your own lives you'd  all be in jail. OSCAR ushers ACE out, past WEBB and Gaming Investigator  AUSTIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Overlapping) ...a gaming license, yesterday's  hearing was to determine whether  someone with Rothstein's checkered  personal history was qualified to  officially hold the top gaming post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAGGI hands STONE an issue of the Las Vegas Sun showing a photograph of ACE at the licensing hearing. Headline read 'Rothstein out of gaming: Control Board Rules against  Rothstein License Application'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from previous scene  continued) Fuckin' hypocrites! STONE stands beside GAGGI's car door. GAGGI is in the bac seat with his window down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's he gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know (Sighs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doin'? He knows all those  guys he yelled at are friends of  ours. What's the matter with him,  making all this mess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he could run things with another  job title. Wouldn't be the best,  but, uh, what are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However he runs things, it's gotta  be quiet. Let him hide upstairs in  the office. Say he's the janitor, I  don't give a shit. But, please,  whatever job he takes, make sure  it's something quiet. STONE walks back to his car. Both cars pull out in opposi directions.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A video monitor shows a title card, reading: 'From the  Tangiers Hotel'. TRUDY, Ace's showgirl sidekick, is heard over the opening credit sequence of the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the Tangiers  Hotel proudly presents the all-new  Sam Rothstein Show, Aces High.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: The monitor shows a neon sign reading, 'Welcome to Fabulo Las Vegas, Nevada', then shows several gamblers at a crap table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, taped live from the all-new  sportsbook, we present the premiere  showing of Aces High. With the... The video monitor shows a neon sign: 'Stardust', then ano 'Tangiers'. WE SEE TRUDY ON A STAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) ...Sasha Semenoff Orchestra... THE CAMERA PANS TO SASHA SEMENOFF CONDUCTING HIS BAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the Sam Rothstein Dancers.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE.
dialogues.text: We see ACE greeting various guests in the audience as he  moves towards the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein is a professional gambler  and the best football handicapper... A video monitor shows a montage featuring showgirls, a ch carving beef and three women wearing bathing suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in American, a man who will take  you inside the real Las Vegas as no  one has ever done before. And now,  ladies and gentlemen, the new... ACE joins TRUDY on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Entertainment Director of the  Tangiers Hotel Casino: Mr Sam  Rothstein. ACE approaches his desk as TRUDY sits on a long sofa. The audience applauds. The band plays and the dancers complete their number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Seated at a desk a  la Johnny Carson) Welcome to the Sam Rothstein Show. We're very happy to have you here  this evening. The young lady to my  left is Trudy, who is a lead new  dancer in our fabulous show from  Paris. Audience applauds, she waves hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first guest this evening... is  Frankie Avalon. FRANKIE AVALON walks to the stage, embracing TRUDY and sh ACE's hand. Audience applauds. WEBB stands in the rear of the sportsbook/theater with AU and DUPREY, watching ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on him. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, I've got a large family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) How many kids do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Uh, I'm very proud to say that we  have eight children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) Eight children! (He encourages the  audience to applaud.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) No, no, no, no, please, please,  please, please, no, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone, to  audience) That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) There was nothing to it. (Chuckles) It was my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN and ARTHUR CAPP are solemnly watching another episo of Ace's TV show with an elderly juggler guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace, don't do it. ACE begins to juggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no. No, no. Oh, Jesus...  he's juggling! The audience cheers him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From next scene) Let's not take County Commissioner  Pat Webb too seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) I recently challenged him to a debate  on this program and he declined.  What are you worried about, Pat?   You don't have to send me any  questions. You can ask me anything  you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From next scene) What the hell is he doin' on  television, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: HOME
dialogues.text: Vegas Sun newspaper front page photo of ACE on television Headline reads: 'Rothstein Sues Gaming Commission'. STONE is sitting across from GAGGI at his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on all night, screamin' about  how he's gonna take his damn lawsuit  all the way to the Supreme Court. He  really must be crazy. He's gonna go  to Washington with this?  (Chuckles.) He's out of his fuckin' mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From next scene) It's a pity in this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into microphone) ...state that we have such hypocrisy.  Some people can do whatever they  want. Other people have to pay through  the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From previous scene) But such is life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, go see him. Tell him maybe  it's time he should quit.

dialogues.speaker: VEGAS
dialogues.text: SHERBERT and ACE pull up beside another parked car. ACE g out of his car in a robe and pajamas and gets into STONE' car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, what they did was  totally unconstitutional. We're  already on the list to be heard before  the Supreme Court of the United States  later this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys back home don't give a  fuck about the Supreme Court and any  of this bullshit! They want things  to quiet down. They want you to walk  away from -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away? Andy, you can't be serious.  How can I walk away? Don't you see  what's goin' on here? Don't you see  what's at stake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man said, 'Maybe your friend  should give in.'  And when the old  man says 'maybe', that's like a papal  bull. Not only should you quit, you  should run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what my problem is? Every time  they mention my name in the papers,  these cocksuckers, they mention Nicky,  too. How the fuck does that help?  I  mean, the heat he brought down is  murder!  We had a police department  who was cooperative. He's pissed  them off so much now that nobody can  make a move anymore. I mean, what do  you do about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you propose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, he doesn't listen to  me. Maybe he should...  get lost for  a while. Take a vacation. Would that  be so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ain't sendin' Nicky nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, look, if he took a break,  it would just give everybody some  time to maneuver. That's all I'm  saying. It's all that I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would forget about the maneuver. I  would just get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs) I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER is on the phone with GINGER; NICKY listens in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) You know, I don't feel like playin'  tennis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as soon as Andy got back home,  Nicky heard about our talk in the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Let's go to lunch. Do you want to go  to the Riviera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next morning bright and early, I get  the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) One o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE listens in on GINGER's and JENNIFER's conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) You know, I've got to do some shopping  afterwards. Do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Well, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But just getting a call from Nicky  wasn't easy anymore. Even the codes  didn't work. So, we figured out  another act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bored FBI man, seated at his desk with a tape recorder headphones, looks at his wrist watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, if a phone's tapped, the  Feds can only listen in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on the stuff involving crimes. So  on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...routine calls, they have to click  off after a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah, and I get a sprained fuckin'  elbow. The FBI man clicks off the tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER quickly hands the phone to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER hands the phone to ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Meet me at three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) What - what, Caesar's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No, a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...hundred yards further down the  road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Don't ask questions. Just be there. NICKY gives the phone back to JENNIFER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE gives the phone to GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To himself) Always asking questions. He exits.
