dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Suzy Creamcheese has the exact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bored FBI agent clicks on again and hears GINGER and  JENNIFER's inane conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...same outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles, over  telephone) But I saw something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...something very... cute. ACE sits down on the couch behind her and lights a cigare

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Through a windows of a motel room across the street from Gold Rush, an FBI AGENT watches NICKY and MARINO exit the jewelry store, get into a parked car and rive away. IRIS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into a radio) Okay, he, uh, he's out. It's the  ant, uh, Brown unit. And he's with,  uh, bogie. I think it's Frankie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky started out before me because  it wasn't that easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for him to get around anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) Okay, pulled out... SWISH PAN TO NICKY AND MARINO DRIVING DOWN THE STREET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) ...pretty fast. He's headed upstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky couldn't even go for a ride  without changing... SWISH PAN TO FBI CAR TRAILING BEHIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cars at least six times before he  could shake all his tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY's car with MARINO driving pulls in; NICKY jumps out and gets in another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because of all the planes, he  had to use underground garages. MARINO drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY's second car screeches in to another garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY hurries across the lot to another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY changes cars again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is running to yet another car. He drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solitary ACE waiting in the vast desert, looking around ACE looks at a sage brush and sand and a few rocks on the desert floor. This could be a hole meant for him. He step away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeting in the middle of the desert  always made me nervous. It's a scary place. I knew about the holes in the desert, course, and everywhere I looked, there could have been a  hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerial shot of NICKY driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, my prospects of comin'  back alive from a meeting with Nicky  were ninety-nine out of a hundred.   But this time, when I heard him say,  'A couple a hundred yards down the  road', I gave myself fifty-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE still standing in the desert. NICKY's car suddenly ap as a reflection in ACE's sunglasses, shaking ACE out of h desert-induced reverie. NICKY's car pulls up by ACE. He g out and storms up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck you get off talkin'  to people about me behind my back?   Goin' over my head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people! What'd you think, I  wasn't gonna find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what you're talkin'  about, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? You said I'm bringin' heat on  you?! I gotta listen to people because  of your fuckin' shit?! You're ordering  me out?! You better get your own  fuckin' army, pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything. I mean, I didn't  order you or anybody...  I only told  Andy Stone that you had a lot of  heat on you, and that was a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to get out of my own  fuckin' town?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I said I - let the bullshit  blow over for a while so I can run  the casino. Anything goes wrong with  the casino, it's my ass. It's not  yours, it's my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know whether you know  this or not, but you only have your  fuckin' casino because I made that  possible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) I'm what counts out here! Not your  fuckin' country clubs or your fuckin'  TV shows! And what the fuck are you  doin' on TV anyhow?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) You know I get calls from back home  every fuckin' day?!  They think you  went batshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only on TV because I gotta be  able to hang around the casino. You  understand that. You know that. Come  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fuckin' ass! You could have had  the food and beverage job without  goin' on television!  You wanted to  go on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did want to go on TV. That  way I have a forum. I can fight back.   I'm known. People see me. They know  they can't fuck around with me like  they could if I was an unknown. That's  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're makin' a big fuckin' spectacle  of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?! I wouldn't even be in this  situation if it wasn't for you. You  brought down so much fuckin' heat on  me. I mean, every time I meet somebody  here, the big question is do I know  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Now you want to blame your  fuckin' license on me, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it - it - Nicky, when you asked  me if you could come out here, what  did I tell you? I mean, you asked  me, and I knew you were going to  come out no matter what I said, but  what did I tell you? Do you remember  what I told...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) Back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you? Do you remember what I told  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back - Back up, back up a fuckin'  minute here. One minute. I asked  you?! When the fuck did I ever ask  you if I could come out here?! Get  this through your head, you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) You never - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this through your head, you Jew  motherfucker, you. You only exist  out here because of me!  That's the  only reason!  Without me, you,  personally, every fuckin' wiseguy  skell [Skell: the lowest form of  wiseguy - a drunken bum] around'll  take a piece of your fuckin' Jew  ass! Then where you gonna go?!  You're  fuckin' warned! Don't ever go over  my fuckin' head again! You  motherfucker, you! NICKY drives off, leaving an angry and frustrated ACE to  ponder the desert and the holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead of ACE, OSCAR, SHERBERT, TRUDY and showgirls wal down the zebra pattern carpet of the nightclub. They are  escorted to their table. NICKY, MARINO and DOMINICK are seated at another table in the rear of the club so no one can hear their conversatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got company. ACE avoids looking at NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see that? Dumb Jew  motherfucker. Grew up together and  he's actin' like he don't even know  me. I know we're supposed to avoid  each other, but, you know, there's  ways to do things and there's ways  not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fuck him. SHERBERT and the others make a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Abraham Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L'chaim. [Yiddish for 'to life']

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. Good luck. NICKY watches ACE's entourage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it, Nick. Don't let it  bother you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, does it look like it's bothering  me? What do I give a fuck?  Fuckin'  Oscar too. All the fuckin' money  I've given that prick, he don't even  look over here. What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Jews stick together, don't  they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're havin' a good time too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are we. NICKY, MARINO and DOMINICK are isolated and alone at thei table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE sleeping. A hot line to the casino rings as a red lig blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERBERT is calling ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly into telephone) Sam, we got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) The little guy. He's half in the  bag, and nobody told him he was eighty- sixed from the joint, so we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...all turned our heads and made out  like we didn't know who he was. He's  over at the twenty-one table with  his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is betting every spot on the blackjack table. MARIN is standing behind him. The DEALER is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nose wide open. He took the money  out of his own kick. His nose is  open for about ten thousand. SHERBERT and the pit boss look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, he's really pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Oh, no. Sits up and throws off the bed covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) He wants a fifty-thousand marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) No, just - just give him, give him  ten. That's it. Ten.  I'll be right  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY) He's gonna come up with ten thousand,  just the way you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thou? No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...give you ten thousand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grabbing SHERBERT's  lapel) Fifty! I said fifty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, take -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pushing him away and  walking back to the  blackjack table) Fuckin' fifty thousand!  Go get it.  I don't give a fuck where you get  it. (To FEMALE DEALER.) Fuckers!  They take it, but they  don't want to give it back. NICKY turns up another bad card and looks at the dealer. smiles as she slides the house winnings over to her side the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck can you grin? How the  fuck could you grin? The FEMALE DEALER looks to her PIT BOSS for help. He step up to a MALE DEALER at a neighboring table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much I'm stuck? You  give a fuck? The MALE DEALER walks up to the FEMALE DEALER and taps he on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do ya?! She lays down some cards, claps her hands to show the Eye the-Sky that they are empty, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To departing FEMALE

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Give yourself a hand right  across your fuckin' mouth. The MALE DEALER takes her place behind the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this fuckin' beaut they put  in now. Sherbert send you in here to  rob me now? Been fuckin' knockin'  everybody's dick in all night? Huh?   You been beatin' all the customers  tonight, motherfucker? We see the PIT BOSS lock up the chip tray from the table dealer has just left. NICKY has a diminished stack of chi and an upturned ten and a two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, jag-off? Hit me. The card is a king or a 'paint', a picture card, meaning  that NICKY has lost. Everyone freezes in fear. NICKY takes the paint and flick it at the DEALER's chest where it sticks to his shirt.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this stiff and pound it up your  fuckin' ass! Hit me again. The DEALER looks to the PIT BOSS who nods 'okay'. He turn over a card. It's another paint, a queen. NICKY flicks th card to the DEALER's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this one and stick it up your  sister's ass! Hit me again. The DEALER looks to the PIT BOSS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, keep lookin' at him, you  fuckin' dummy. If you had any fuckin'  heart at all, you'd be out fuckin'  stealin' for a livin'. (Tossing the card at  the DEALER.) Hit me again. The DEALER looks at the PIT BOSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you keep lookin' at  him for, huh, you fuckin' pu- The DEALER deals him another paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, twenty fuckin' paints  in a row. Hit me again! ACE enters the casino with SHERBERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY) He's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the DEALER) You should pay as fast as you collect,  you know. NICKY gets up to go over to ACE, glowering at SHERBERT as walks past. ACE and NICKY are partially hidden behind a pillar by the slot-machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin'? You gotta get  out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sammy, tell this Jew motherfucker  over here to pay that marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, Nicky, you're not listenin'  to me. I'm here to help you. What's  the matter with you?  You're gonna  bury us both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the money. Fuckin' give  me the fuckin' money, Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna okay you ten and get you  even, and that's it. Then you got to  get out of here before the cops and  the newspapers are all over you. To the PIT BOSS, holding up ten fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten and that's it. He makes a throat cutting gesture with his hand. ACE leav NICKY turns to walk back to the table. He sees SHERBERT  standing right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you starin' at, you bald- headed Jew prick?! Before SHERBERT can answer, NICKY grabs the receiver off wall phone and hits him across the face and back. SHERBER falls to the floor. NICKY pulls the cradle off the pillar and tosses it down on his back. He and MARINO walk back t the table, SHERBERT winces on the floor in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue me, you Jew fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Get out of here? I got a marker  comin'. He puts some chips down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To DEALER) Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER are seated across from OSCAR, their lawyer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but everything's changed  now. You're talking about a divorce.   You're even asking for alimony  payments and... child support... and  now custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want what any divorced woman  would get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean she's only sober about two  hours a day. It's usually from eleven  in the morning until one in the  afternoon. And if I gave her her  money and her jewels now, you know  what she's gonna do? She's gonna  piss it all away in about a year,  and then where will she be? (To GINGER.) Where would you be then? Comin' right  back to me, right back to me. (To OSCAR.) Or finding some other excuse to come  and I - I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) We had a deal. Remember that? (To OSCAR.) He said if it didn't work out between  us, that I could get my things and I  could leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To GINGER, leaning  closer to her) Look in my eyes. Look in my eyes. GINGER turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. Do you see anything in  these eyes that makes you think I  would ever let someone in your  condition take my child away from  me? (Pause.) Do you?  You know that won't happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after all this time... and as  hard as I tried, as much as I  wanted...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: ACE, with Kleenex sticking out of his collar to protect h shirt from his television make-up, walks back to the dres room with TRUDY. She pecks his cheek before exiting to he own room. A security guard opens the door for ACE. We follow him past numerous showgirls and costumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I could never reach her. I could  never make her love me. I always  felt she should have gone for all  that money... being somebody for the  first time in her life, a home and a  kid. But that's not what happened.  It just didn't work out that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the showgirls) Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what could we do? After a  while, we'd just take breathers from  each other. You know, little  separations. At that time, I remember  Ginger took Amy and went to Beverly  Hills. She was gonna spend a week or  so shopping. ACE picks up the phone at a make-up table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yes, Mr Rothstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Operator, the Beverly Hotel in Beverly  Hills, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER, sporting a new short hairstyle, and AMY exit and  walk towards camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Beverly Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Sam Rothstein, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Mr. and Mrs. Rothstein  have checked out already. TRACK BACK, AS GINGER SMILES, TO REVEAL LESTER DIAMOND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. GINGER kisses LESTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) M- Uh, Mr. and Mrs. Rothstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY) Hey, little Dale Evans. GINGER laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they both checked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Thank you. (He hangs up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE steps up to a public phone as it rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone, sighs) Uh, my wife is w-with an old friend  of her i-in LA.

dialogues.speaker: HOME
dialogues.text: FORLANO is on the phone, taking notes with a pencil. GAGG is sitting in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Some low-life. A guy named Lester  Diamond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) My daughter's with 'em too and I  think they're gonna try and kidnap  her. Is there anybody you can send?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) We'll take care of it. FORLANO hangs up and walks over to GAGGI. We hear the doo from the following scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE opens the door to two Tangiers EXECUTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) We got a number and an address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is standing behind his desk on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, is this Lester? This is Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Rothstein. I want to talk to  Ginger. Put her on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) She's not here, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Lester...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...listen to me very carefully. I  want to talk to Ginger. I want my  kid back. I want her put on a plane  immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) I know she's there. Don't fuck around  with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Uh, I'm not. Sam, I wouldn't... He snaps his fingers to get GINGER's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...wouldn't do it. Yeah, no, I, I... We see GINGER on LESTER's living-room couch, cutting line of cocaine with a razor blade in front of MAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering to AMY) You shouldn't do this. LESTER steps up to the living-room snapping his fingers t GINGER. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) You understand? Put her on the fuckin'  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Sam, I - I don't know where she is,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) So, l-l-l-listen, I te- I te- I tell  you - can I call you back in a few  minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) 702 472 1862.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm. (Pretending to write  it down.) 1862. Okay, good. I'll call you right  b-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) I'll call you right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) You got it. (He hangs up; then to  himself as he walks  through a doorway to  the living-room) Schmuck. (To GINGER.) All right. I just bought us a few  minutes. Want to get back at this  prick? He sticks his finger in the coke and rubs it on his gums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?  Okay, you got, what, two million  dollars in that box? GINGER snorts some cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... you got a minute? Hey. He's  got two million in the box, am I  right?  Okay, you let him keep your  jewels. We take the cash and the  only other thing he cares about. (He points to AMY.) Huh?  Her majesty. We go to Europe.  You dye your hair, get some pl-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupts) I don't want to go to Europe. I want  to go to see The Elephant Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna go see any fuckin'  elephants, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY) We'll go later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY) We're going to Europe. Let the adults  talk. (To GINGER.) You dye your hair... you get plastic  surgery, like we talked about. Right?   You're the mother. How much do you  think he's gonna pay to get this  fuckin' kid back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To AMY) Shut your mouth! GINGER puts her hand over AMY's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where she gets this from!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you - You want me to come over  there? I'll smack your face. AMY sticks her tongue out at LESTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me any of your shit! (To GINGER.) Okay, this has always been a dream,  but we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester - he called you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sniffs) He called you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just talked to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs) So, he knows where you are. That  means he's sending some guys over  here probably right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger... It means he's sitting by  the phone like a dumb-bell, waiting  for me to call him back. Now, I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting and  getting up) That's - Yeah, he's sitting by the  phone like a dumb-bell, just waiting  for you to call him back. That's  what he's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) He's sittin' by the phone -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yelling) What do you think we're gonna do?  He's probably got guys outside the  fuckin' house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gathering AMY,  hysterical) Get your bag! Come on, get your bag!  Get your things! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this bullshit. It's just bullshit  right here. This is the fuckin'  problem, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hysterical) Oh, what bullshit? What, do you want  to fuckin' talk it over now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done yakkin', okay? You're  done yakkin' now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grabbing her purse  and rushing AMY out) Go! Go! Get in the car! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mimicking GINGER) 'Go! Go! Go!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is leaning against a public phone. MARINO watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) You just relax. Nobody's killin'  anybody, do you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No, I really do. I think he's gonna  kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) You just relax, and call me back  here in exactly an hour, on this  phone, and I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah, uh-huh... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY is swinging her purse at LESTER in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) So, I'm gonna call you back in an  hour... at this number, and you're  gonna be there, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) And listen, don't do anything else  crazy, okay? You all right? Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Bye. She hangs up and walks over to LESTER and AMY who are  fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just knock it off! Would you two  knock it off? Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She started it. She started the whole  thing. I'm just standin' here. GINGER opens the driver's side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna drive. Don't even  think you're gonna drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm gonna drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stopping GINGER) No, I'm not gonna drive with some  crazy -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yelling) You're driving me nuts! She walks around to the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the passenger's side! And I'm  sendin' this kid to Bolivia in a  fuckin' box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through glass doors we see ACE seated in his living-room. NICKY slips into frame and taps on the window, gesturing  that he wants to talk. ACE signals for him to go around t the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY walks past GINGER's white Mercedes towards ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger - He's cut off by ACE who points to the passenger's side of his Cadillac. NICKY walks around and gets in. ACE starts engine to make it harder for anyone to listen in on their conversation. ACE turns the volume down. He looks straight ahead, away  from NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After an awkward  moment) Ginger called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Polite, careful,  smoking a cigarette) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you. She called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what'd she want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was afraid to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's with that cocksucker  again... and they got Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's why I'm here. She wants  to come back, but she's afraid you're  gonna whack her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're gonna kidnap my kid.  What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Why didn't you come to me? I  mean, this is family, it ain't  business. Meanwhile, you make calls  back home. Sammy, it makes us look  bad out here, you know what I mean?   Back and forth, this one and that  one, and, in the meantime, she's  gone anyway. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighing) I don't know. What am I gonna do  with this woman? I don't know... (Pause.) She's drivin' me fuckin' crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think if you, uh, okay it, you  know, assure her that she's gonna be  all right, she'll come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's driving me fuckin' crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, once you get her here, you  think about it, you know?  But get  the kid back here. She wants to come  back. That's the, uh, that's the  main thing here. You want your kid,  don't you? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is on the phone. In the background, AMY is acting in the back seat of the car and driving LESTER crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs, into telephone) Hi, it's me. (Chuckling.) Just who you wanted to talk to, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is seated at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...uh-uh-uh - I'm not gonna ask you  where you are, just please, put Amy  on a plane. Just put her on right  away, any plane to get her here right  away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...please. That's all I'm askin'  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Do you... I mean... I don't think  she should go by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs, into telephone) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone,  holding back tears) What I mean is, you think if, uh, do  you think if I came back... do you  think you could forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Uh, (sighs) I don't know. I gotta tell you, I  don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) I under-understand that. I-I know I  fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) What about the money? Uh, where's  the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) I gotta tell ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...I-I... made some mistakes and I  spent some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) What's it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...under?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Pretty serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) How serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, uh, it's under twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) It's under...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...twenty-five thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...the rest of the two million is  still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, yeah, I got the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Okay, no big deal. That's okay. Yeah.  He got his twenty-five. (Sighs.) That I'll live with. Any more I  couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...all right. Where are you? I'll  send a plane for you right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE sees GINGER and AMY coming off the Tangiers private j GINGER wobbles a little as she comes down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Waving brightly) Hi, Sam. ACE picks AMY up and hugs her, ignoring GINGER. They walk the car and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY looks on from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what'd ya do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needed some clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sighs) Twenty-five thousand for clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted a watch, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five thousand for clothes and  a watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) Mr. R...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and GINGER, dressed for dinner just like any other co walk towards a table overlooking the colorful lights of  downtown Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...good evening. Signora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they are led to  their table) The good part was, I had Amy back.  So, we went home, had the housekeeper  stay over, put the kid to bed, I  calmed myself down and we went to  dinner. I tried to keep things nice  and civil, you know.  But... hey,  twenty-five thousand for three suits?  That doesn't make much sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Seated across from  GINGER at a booth) First of all, he's not gonna wear f-  thousand-dollar suits. But let's say  he did, which he won't. How you gonna  get fitted for twenty-five suits in  three days?  I, um, I mean, how could  you get fitted that fast? I can't  get fitted that fast, and I pay twice  as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought him a watch too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But even if you bought him a watch,  a really nice watch, one that he  thought was nice - and he doesn't  know what the fuck a good watch is -  so, you go, five, ten, twelve grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the most, which is impossible for  him. She glances to the table behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, at the most, three suits, a  thousand apiece. That still leaves  what?  Around ten thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Staring down at her  plate, trying to  restrain herself) Would you knock it off, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tryin' to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' to figure out. I'm  home... we're workin' it out. She lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I've been told that before,  'We're workin' it out.' You think  that you're home... after what you  just put me through with Amy, is a  favor to me? She looks at ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause) So, counting the watch, let's say  another four thousand for expenses  over the weekend... of which you  must have had a good time. I know he  did.  That's for sure. I know that...  fuckin' piece of shit had a good  fuckin' time. On my money. You might  as well have fucked him, which you  probably did anyway. GINGER glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lookin' at me a certain way.  You - you're teary-eyed, huh? You're  upset. You're a good actress, you  know that?  Good fuckin' actress.  You can fuckin' get that pity out of  people. I'm not a john, you  understand?  You always thought I  was, but I'm not. And I'm not a  sucker. That fuckin' pimp cocksucker.  He's lucky I didn't kill him last  time. Lucky he's fuckin' livin'.   And if you would've stayed with Amy...  and you would've ran away... you  would've been fuckin' dead. GINGER scoots out of the booth and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you. Dead. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide overhead of ACE alone in bed. Off-screen, we hear GI a little drunk, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering into  telephone) I cannot do it anymore. I can't  fuckin' live like this. It's not  right. ACE's point of view as he moves towards the sound of GING voice. He enters frame and stops to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you? Yes, of course - He  doesn't come home at night.  What is  the big fuckin' deal? I go - Yes,  and I just - I can't fuckin' take  it. Why should I fucking take it?  That wasn't the deal. He acts like...   like I'm the only one around here  with a fuckin' past. He'll never let  me live it down.  Well... well, I  mean, I tried. What the fuck do you  think I came back here for? No, I'm  not! ACE slips into the foyer where he can see GINGER's reflec in a glass door as she talks on the phone in the living-r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering into  telephone) I want to have him killed. Yes, I  want him killed.  I've fuckin' had  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) So, are you with me on this? ACE steps up behind her. She gasps, still holding the pho Petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get rid of me? Here I  am. Go ahead, get rid of me (ACE grabs the phone.) Hello. He hears nothing and throws the phone down near her. GINGER rises and attacks ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grunting) Yes! I fuckin' hate you! I can't  take it anymore! ACE grapples with GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I want to kill you! I hate your  fuckin' guts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate my guts? I want you to come  with me now. He drags her by her arms across the living-room hallway,  into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off of me! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me now! Come with me now.  Come with me now. I want you out of  here. GINGER screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you out of here! I want you  out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Starting to get up) Let go of me! Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her against the closet wall, and throws an over bag at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your (kicking the bag) fuckin' bag and get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go, but I want my money right  now! ACE tosses clothes at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get your money! Don't worry. GINGER squats down and starts to gather her stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arrangement is over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tossing clothes) No kidding. NO KIDDING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I still get my money. I need  some cash right now. You can't just  put me in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get your cash. You haven't been  straight with me ever since I met  you! You never loved me in the first  place!  I need eyes in the back of  my fuckin' head with you, you fuckin'  bitch! ACE walks past her to his side of the large walk-in close Racks and racks of her clothes are still hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you?! She tosses a pair of red shoes at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I love you?! How can I  love you?! You treat me like I'm  your fucking dog! ACE leans down and opens a shoe box filled with money. He grabs as much cash as he can hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lower than a dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! He walks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shoving the bundles  of cash in her face) Here. Here. Is this enough money?!  Huh?  Will it last you two fuckin'  days? Take it, greedy bitch. (Stuffing the money  in her bag.) Take the fuckin' money you fuckin'  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the bank and I'm getting  my jewelry too! She puts on a white fur coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no kidding. Good! It opens at  9 a.m. Be there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't send your guys down there  to stop me! I mean it. She bends down to pick up her bag, but ACE insists on car it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guarantee you, I will not stop  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and ACE walk through their bedroom to the front do He's carrying her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! You aren't getting rid of me  with one fuckin' suitcase!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll come back tomorrow and get  the rest. Just get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. (Sniffs, walking back.) I'm takin' Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stopping her) You're not takin' Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm wakin' her up right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stoned. You're a junkie. Get  out of here. He opens the door and tosses her suitcase out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not! She's my daughter too!  Goddamn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! He shoves her out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send my lawyers a letter. (Slamming the door  behind her.) God-fuckin'-damn you! He locks the door, and peers through the peep-hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through the doors as  ACE walks away) You're not getting away with this!  You're not gonna fuck me out of my  end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is furious. She picks up the suitcase and walks up her sportscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker! (Sobs.) She drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is lying awake in bed smoking a cigarette, watching t casino's Eye in the Sky surveillance monitors. He hears a car turn into his driveway. He sees the car's headlight b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funny thing was, that after all  that... I didn't want her to go. She  was the mother of my kid. I loved  her. And later... I realized I didn't  want to give her the money, because  if I did... I knew I'd never see her  again. ACE reaches over to take GINGER's hand - she slowly takes hold of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is getting AMY ready for school. ACE enters as AMY on her way out. He holds her face in his hands and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Affectionately) Oh. Have a good day at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Amy exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Okay, angel. ACE walks over to GINGER who turns sullenly to look at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Clears throat.) From now on, I have to know where  you and Amy are at all times. He takes a beeper out of his coat pocket and holds it up GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gently) Now, here's a beeper. I want you to  keep it on you. It's very light.  So  I can call you whenever I have to. GINGER reluctantly takes the beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause.) Okay? She nods silently. He looks at her and turns, leaving her alone in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very large trailer is in the middle of an empty constru site. GINGER's and NICKY's cars are parked outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From trailer) Well, what are you supposed to do? I  mean, what do you want to do?  Do  you want to stay the way you are?  You want to stay like this?  You  can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and NICKY are alone in the large trailer. They are sitting close together on a couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, listen, two people don't get  along, at some point you gotta call  it... I mean, it's none of my  business, but I ... I think that's  what you gotta do. You gotta take it  somewhere -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smoking a cigarette) Oh, you're right, I know.  It's...  well, I was just -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you gonna say? Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't - (Sighs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you were gonna say. Go  ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinkin', maybe... you  know somebody at the bank...  could  help me get my jewelry out?  There's  a lot of money in there. Lot of money  in there, and I'd be willing to take  care of anybody who helped me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pauses) Let me think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See who I got in there. Gotta get  somebody I can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 'Cause, you know, (leaning her head  back) He's never gonna give me my jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds that key so tight, he's  probably got it stuck up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chuckles) Yeah, right. That's Sammy. And he's  probably got it there too. Takes a sip of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so fuckin' lucky. I could have  buried him. I could have gone to  Europe and taken the baby. And then  he'd've tracked me down and he'd've  killed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he wouldn't. I would have. (GINGER chuckles.) And he'd've been right, too. I mean,  seriously. (She cuddles closer  to him.) Well, there's one thing you don't  do. You don't take a guy's kid and  then take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) I didn't. (Chuckles.) I didn't. I mean, I did, but then I  did exactly what you told me to do,  and I came right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. NICKY embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. I like that. I like that.  That's what I like about you. You  did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Playing with his  jacket) I did what you told me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you always tell me the right  thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (Pause, with his arm  around her.) Boy, he really fucked himself up out  here - (She caresses his  face.) - didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything went to his head. (He sighs, rubbing  her neck.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In unison) Changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did. He ain't the same person,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) No, he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really thinks who the fuck he is,  I'll tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Holding back tears) Exactly. (Sighs.) He hates me. She rests her head on NICKY's shoulder, starting to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hates my fuckin' guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, you're a toughie.  You can take this. (Runs his hand down  her cheek.) Don't cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Crying) I'm not as tough as you think I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) I'm not and he scares the shit out  of me. I never know what he's gonna  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) Come on. Don't be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Softly, through tears) I need some help. I do. I need some  help. (Strokes his chest.) You gotta help me. I need a new  sponsor, Nicky. GINGER's sobs subside a little and her hand starts to str NICKY's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) I do. I need a new sponsor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly, cheek to  cheek) Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sponsor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm... okay. Don't worry about it.  Nobody'll fuck with ya anymore.   I'll take care of ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering) Nicky, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I will. It's what you want,  isn't it? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) Thank you. Yeah, yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Uh-huh - NICKY interrupts and kisses her. She kisses him back. He  pushes her head down to his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY opens the door to the trailer and peers out to make sure no one is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see past a chain-link fence to a camper. We hear the s of photos being taken with a high-speed camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see GINGER and NICKY slip out of the trailer in the  deserted work site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI MEN with long-lens cameras are recording the event on film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ace's wife. Still photos: NICKY and GINGER steal a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic! Still photos: Click. Click. GINGER and NICKY embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AGENTS watch as GINGER and NICKY move towards their  separate cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great for the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER gets into her car. Still photos: Click: GINGER getting into her car. Click:  NICKY getting into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and GINGER drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is waiting for GINGER. He hears a car pull into the d way, he gets up and looks out the sliding glass door. It' GINGER. He sits back down, motionless with a glass of mil She walks in with a sack of groceries and some dry cleani

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. She puts her purse and the groceries down on the kitchen  counter, and hangs up the dry cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. You didn't answer your beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threw it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threw it away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As she puts some  items away) Look, I tried to do this thing. I  know that you want me to, but it's  just - You know, I'm driving down  the freeway and the fuckin' thing's  'beep-beep-beep-beep'. You know, I'm  in a restaurant and it's - it's  embarrassing. I don't want to do it  anymore. (Stopping suddenly.) Where's Amy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put her to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (Walking away towards  their bedroom.) I got your cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER sets some items down on her dressing-table, in fro of a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar wants you to call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, who'd you go to lunch with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Riviera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause) What'd you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a... salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Jennifer have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Turning to ACE) She had the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause) Okay. I want you to call Jennifer  and I want you to tell her to tell  you what she had for lunch, and I'm  gonna listen in on the other line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I want to do it. Just  do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. (Walking out and down  the hall.) Just gonna get the bowl for my thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is on the hall phone, dialing. We hear a phone rin through the earpiece. She waits a few seconds and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line's busy. There's nobody there. She starts to walk away. ACE stops her, picks up the phon and dials. We hear JENNIFER answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Hello, Jennifer, it's Sam - TIGHT ON GINGER'S FINGERS CUTTING OFF THE CALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... I didn't have lunch  with Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hanging up) Who were you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) I was with somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you were with somebody. Who  was it? (Pause.) I just hope it's not someone who I  think it might be. (Sighs, then whispers:) I just hope it's not them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) I knew she fucked around. (Sighing.) You know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them are seated separately. GINGER is on the f leaning against a chair, crying softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she did what she did and I did  what I had to do. But, Jesus, Nicky  was the worst thing she could've  done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he won't stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it could get us both killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can back him off. ACE sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was very convincing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neon signs reads: LA CONCHA MOTEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...when she wanted to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... this... this is how she backed  him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and NICKY are making love on the bed, panting, gru and gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have finished making love. NICKY is zipping up his p GINGER still sits on the bed smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ginger... don't forget, if you're  challenged, you know, if he asks  anything, deny everything. (He walks up to her.) Do you understand? I don't want him  bringin' beefs back home ... 'cause  that could be a problem. You gotta  be careful. He's not dumb, you know?  You hear what I'm sayin', right? Her arm and thigh are bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. You don't have to tell me  that. What do you think,  (chuckling) I'm stupid? She takes a drag off her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I think you're stupid? No, I think  you're beautiful. (He bends down and  kisses her.) But I gotta go. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car moves into the station and stops at a gas pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...time, Nicky had things so fucked  up on the streets, that every time  Marino went back home, the...

dialogues.text: Slow motion of MARINO walking through the front office pa a few men. He tosses his cigarette butt and puts it out w his shoe. He looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...packages got smaller and smaller.  It got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINO takes a small stack of cash out of his coat. A sea GAGGI nods for one of his men to take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to the point when he walked into  the place... he didn't know whether  he was gonna be kissed or killed. GAGGI's man takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie, I want to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's private... but I want you to  tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Remo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to tell me the truth,  mind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always tell you the truth, Remo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie... the little guy, he wouldn't  be fuckin' the Jew's wife, would he?  Because if he is... it's a problem. FREEZE FRAME OF MARINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could I say? I knew if I gave  the wrong answer, I mean, Nicky,  Ginger, Ace, all of 'em could've  would up gettin' killed. FREEZE FRAME OF GAGGI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there's one thing about these  old timers: They don't like any  fuckin' around with the other guy's  wives. It's bad for business. ON MARINO'S FREEZE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I lied... even though I knew  that by lyin' to Gaggi, I could wind  up gettin' killed too. UNFREEZE - LIVE ACTION CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To GAGGI) No. I ain't see anything like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm positive.  Remo... things are  very fucked up down there, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. That's why I'm asking.  You see, my main concern is Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know... if he's doin' all  right. If he's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good. He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm askin' you, Frankie, to keep an  eye on Nicky. Do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see... I wouldn't want to be  jeopardizing anything for people who  are our friends. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (Pause.) Frankie, you're a good boy. Pats MARINO's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Remo. GAGGI drinks from his espresso cup. So does MARINO, looki over cautiously at the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, Nicky and his crew had already  hit rock bottom. I mean, Vegas really  got to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is punching a man who is leaning against a car. The are surrounded by MARINO, FUSCO, BLUE and HARDY. The man  remains erect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booze, the coke, the broads... I  mean, he got sloppy.  He just wasn't  the same Nicky anymore. DOMINICK takes over. Exhausted, NICKY walks to his car an leans on the open car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To NICKY) You must have drunk too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard one night he had to belt a  guy three times before he finally  went down. DOMINICK finally knocks the man down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the old days, Nicky would've decked  him with one shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You add this into the mix...

dialogues.speaker: SNIFFED.
dialogues.text: Maybe Vegas just got . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and his crew get into their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to all of us. And his crew followed  him right over the edge. The man is left alone on the ground of the dingy parking  lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were all tuned up half the time  on coke. I mean, they started doin'...

dialogues.text: ...stupid things.

dialogues.text: Drop your gun or I'll -!

dialogues.text: Hey, fuck you!

dialogues.text: The cops shot him. They shot Blue...

dialogues.text: BLUE is yelling back at the COPS, holding the foil packag

dialogues.text: You know, they could have... The COPS walk up to BLUE, who is on the ground amid shatt glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...been right, but who knows?

dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! What gun? He's got a  fuckin' hero sandwich here.

dialogues.text: Pitch-black?! It -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looked like a fuckin' gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You - You fuckin' moron, I'll be  filling out paper work for the next  two months because of you and this  piece of shit, you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, what are we gonna do? I'm  sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fuckin' jerk-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to make matters worse, to get  even, Nicky's crew got stoned one  night and they started shootin' up  the cops' houses. COP #1 plants a gun on the ground next to BLUE's legs usi a handkerchief to avoid leaving fingerprints.

dialogues.text: The house explodes as gunfire riddles the front of a  detective's home. MARINO, DOMINICK, FUSCO, HARDY and thre HOODS in another car are spraying the home with machine-g and shotguns.

dialogues.text: NICKY and MARINO emerge from the shop.

dialogues.text: I mean, it got to the point where  they couldn't even talk in the Gold  Rush anymore because the Feds put a  wire in the wall.

dialogues.text: Two FBI AGENTS with binoculars are watching NICKY and MAR trying to read their lips.)

dialogues.text: And even when they talked outside,  they had to cover their mouths  because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky found out about it from a teller  who owed him money.  This guy  worked... Voice-over trails off.

dialogues.text: I told him I didn't know nothin'.  But Jiggs and, uh, Tony Gorilla said  if you did anything, you're fucked  up.

dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.text: Yeah, but they keep askin' about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now, sure they're askin'. They  earn with the prick. I got a funny  feelin' he's gonna start a fuckin'  war or somethin'. (Pause) I'm not sure yet, you know. But I w-  You know, but you know what I want  you to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelo and Buster.

dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm not sure yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I'm ready, I'll say the  words, 'Go see the Jew.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you make it disappear, you know  what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just let me know. But you gotta  be ready. You know what I'm talkin'  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say to do anything yet? I said  I'm not sure... I'll let you know. I  want to think about it. Where're  these pricks at? Looks for the FBI AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yeah, either that or in the fuckin'  bank. I don't know. They're all over  the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting up from the  table) Be right back. I'll be right back. He walks over to RUDY, the maitre d'.

dialogues.text: I'm going home for a few seconds.  I'll be right back. ACE hurries out. RUDY picks up the phone and dials a numb

dialogues.text: (Looking around the  house) Hello? Hello! Ginger.

dialogues.text: (Knocking, turning  the doorknob) Amy! Amy, open the door!

dialogues.text: (From her room) I can't! I'm tied!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.text: What happened? What happened? Who  did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a knife and cut you  loose, honey, I'll -

dialogues.text: (Panting) Oh, no, please, please. She tries to keep him from leaving her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Bending down, kisses  her) Okay, I'll be right back. ACE cuts AMY loose with a knife.

dialogues.text: When did this happen, honey?

dialogues.text: I don't know. She gets up and hugs her father.

dialogues.text: You don't know? What time did your  mother do this? When did she leave?

dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Comforting AMY as  she moans) Ohhh... He kisses her. They get up from the bed when the phone ri

dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, uh, who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, what are you doin'? You okay?

dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No, I'm not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...uh, you know, I just wanted to  talk to you a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...Ginger's missing and she tied Amy  up and she locked her in her room. I  gotta find her. I don't know where  the hell she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) She's there with you? (Getting angry.) She's there with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Yeah, she's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) I'll be right there. He hangs up and starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Uh, all right. He hangs up and steps over to DOMINICK and MARINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's comin' over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.text: ACE is stopped by NICKY in the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Trying to calm him) Ace don't... listen, don't... don't  make a scene, all right?

dialogues.text: I want to just talk. I want to talk  to that Irish bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't know who to turn to. (Raising his hand  almost in a plea.) She... she didn't know where to turn.  She was tryin' to save your marriage.

dialogues.text: Yeah? Nicky, I want to talk to that  fuckin' bitch.

dialogues.text: (Menacing) Hey, be fuckin' nice. Calm. Be nice.  Don't fuck up in here. ACE pauses for a beat, realizing that NICKY is standing i his way and could be dangerous. ACE gives him a wide bert We follow ACE through the crowd to GINGER, seated in a bo He sits down angrily across from her.)

dialogues.text: (Stoned, smoking a  cigarette) Hi, Sam.

dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.text: I ought to fuckin' have you committed.  You fuckin' do that again, (pointing his finger  at her) I'll f-, I'll f-

dialogues.text: I should have -

dialogues.text: Listen to me, listen to me, listen  to me. (Pounding his fist on  the table.) Listen, you fuckin' cunt.

dialogues.text: Oh, sh-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.
