dialogues.text: (Knocking her drink  over) Let me tell you something. (Pointing.) Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I w- I was gonna be back before she  woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen carefully! You ever fuckin'  touch her again, you ever do anything  like that again, I'll fuckin' kill  you.  Pure and simple. Do you hear  me? Pure and fuckin' simple, I'll  fuckin' kill you, you bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Leaning in to him) Why don't you just let me go, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sign anything you want me to  sign, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand? What? Let you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want the key to my jewelry,  and I want you to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your jewelry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what? And let you disgrace me,  you fuckin' pig? And let you disgrace  me?  Get up. Get up and be a mother.  Get in the car and go to the house... GINGER darts a look to NICKY who is at the bar, watching  anxiously. He gestures with his head for her to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now. Get up and - ACE notices her look at NICKY but when he turns to see wh she's looking at, he just misses NICKY's gesture. ACE gra GINGER by her collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get - Get up! Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wou- I wouldn't do that if I were  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get - get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up! Get going! (Pushing the table.) Get up! NICKY gestures to her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fu- (Shaking the table.) You threatening me? (Making a fist.) I'll fuckin' kill you in this place! (Pointing to her.) Get up and go home right now. GINGER gets up and leans in to shout at ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Barking) I'm going. I'm going, you -! She grabs her purse and leaves. Patrons stare as ACE foll her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER follows ACE through the door. As soon as she close the door behind her, ACE turns to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you need approval from him to go  home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? So who fuckin' blew you in  the parking lot before you came in...  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Disgusted) You make me sick, you fuck. Once a  fuckin' hooker, always a hooker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck you! Fuck you, Sam Rothstein! (Opening the door.) Fuck you! A furious GINGER turns around and storms out, slamming th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the kitchen sliding glass door: GINGER's engine r and tires screech as she tears away in her her sportscar. ACE dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, Billy Sherbert, please. Put  him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, Bill, listen, I'll explain to  you later. Just - You - You got a  gun at home? Yeah. Bring it over  here right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERBERT is still at the discotheque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Okay. Just take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Right away. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) I-I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Okay. (He hangs up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER's car screeches into the parking lot and she jumps out, leaving her car oor open and engine running. A valet parker approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To VALET PARKER) Leave it where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER bursts in. MARINO tries to calm her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Goddamn it! I want that  Jew bastard killed! I have fuckin'  had it! NICKY walks in from the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, calm down. Shh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. (To MARINO.) Hide her car in the back! He pulls her by her arm to a storage room upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reason to hide my car. He  already knows!  (Walking up the stairs.) He threw it in my face! The second I  get out of here, I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is enraged and panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? Supposing he  goes back home and makes a fuckin'  beef?  I gotta know exactly what you  said. Tell me what you said to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I said... nothin'. I said, I  said, 'No, no, no.' Everything he  said, I just kept sayin' no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you this was fuckin' dangerous.  Remember I said, 'Ginger, this is a  dangerous situation. Be very careful.'  You fuckin' yessed me to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's so fuckin' dangerous, then  why don't you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna kill him. Shut the  fuck up. What, do you know what you're  talkin' about? I'm not killing anyb-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) Oh, well, then, have him killed and  get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Loud and angry) Hey, don't be such a fuckin' smartass,  will you?  I mean, I know the fuckin'  guy thirty-five years, I'm gonna  fuckin' whack him for you?  Fuck...  motherfucker! I knew this, I knew  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Raising his voice  even more) How the fuck am I gonna get your  fuckin' money now? You think he's  gonna give you fuckin' money? Are  you out of your mind?!  Look what  you just did to this fuckin' guy!   If you would have just kept your  fuckin' mouth shut! (Walking away.) Ah, what the fuck is the use? I  should've never got invol- GINGER screams and attacks NICKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grappling with her) What? Hey! Hey! What the fuck are  you... ? NICKY slaps her roughly across the face, grabs the back h jacket and forcefully leads her to a stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you fuck! You're such a fuckin'  asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here. Get out!  Get the fuck out! Shoves her down the stairs. GINGER yells and gasps on her way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From bottom of stairway) Whoa. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Behind GINGER) Get out. Get out! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd I get involved with this fuckin'  nut in the first place? Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna fuckin' kill her. Take  it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pushing a sobbing  GINGER out the back  door) Get her the fuck out of here. Get  her out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINO throws GINGER out the back door. She falls on her  side, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing, getting up) I don't need you! I have my own  fuckin' money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. She stumbles to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going' to the FBI! I'm not scared  anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked with me for the last time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY and MARINO are seated at the back door watching GIN screech out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. (To MARINO.) Hey, come on. Get inside. They turn and walk back inside. MARINO leans on a wall ne to the kitchen. NICKY has scratches on his hand and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fuckin' believe that? (Showing MARINO his  scratches.) Look at this motherfucker. NICKY sits on the bottom step across from MARINO, who sig Cooks mill around in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up, Frankie. I fucked up  good this time. Should have never  started with this fuckin' broad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. What could you do? I  mean, she threw herself at you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a bad fuckin' spot here. You  know that? Bad fuckin' spot. He puts his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see SHERBERT approach the sliding glass door holding a shotgun. ACE lets him in, locks the door and grabs the gu from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the sliding patio doors, we see ACE and SHERBERT  making sure all the doors are locked and the lights are t off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already left the kid with neighbors  and I had about a million in cash  and jewels that I gave to Sherbert  to lock up in the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) Put this in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE leads SHERBERT to the front door as he stuffs a shoeb filled with cash and jewels in a bag and hands it over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...hotel safe, then I want you to  come right back.  ACE shuts the down behind him and switches off a light. T room goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crisp, sunny morning. SHERBERT's car is parked on the s in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exhausted ACE, in his robe, and SHERBERT are seated ac from each other at the bar with the shotgun displayed  prominently on the counter between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pans with GINGER's car as it approaches the drivew and crashes into the back of ACE's parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and SHERBERT react to the noise. SHERBERT grabs the  shotgun. ACE looks out the window at GINGER ramming her c into his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She, she's alone. Just go. Take the  gun and go into Amy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Screaming) You get down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SHERBERT as he  walks around the bar  with the gun) Just wait there for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From driveway) Get down here and talk to me, goddamn  it! Don't fuckin' ignore me! You  motherfucker! SHERBERT exits. ACE runs over to the stairs and starts do them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER repeatedly smashes into ACE's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From her car) I mean it! ACE emerges from the front door, taking cover behind a br column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come down here right now! Come  down here and talk to me, goddamn  it! Fuck you! Goddamn you, come out  here!  I'm gonna drive this fucking  car through the living-room! She starts to drive it across the lawn. ACE darts back to the front door. GINGER's car stops in front of the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting out of the  car to confront ACE) You fucking coward! You motherfucker! She slips and falls on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come out here and talk to me,  you fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From the porch) Will you stop it? You're drunk, you're  on drugs. You're gonna -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to her) You're gonna be sorry if you don't  stop that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you threaten me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll wake the whole neighborhood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Kicking the hedges) Don't you threaten me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female neighbor walks out of her house. A man from the  house next door does the same. We see AMY watching from t neighbor's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not threatening me anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is bending down, breaking off branches from some p and throwing them at ACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck! You fuck! I'm sick of you! ACE flinches as a handful of leaves hits his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am fuckin' Nicky Santoro! I am!  He's my new sponsor! ACE gestures towards the neighbors who are watching. A sq car pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To ACE) What about that, you fuckhead?! (To neighbors.) What are you looking at? Fuck off! Two COPS walk up the driveway towards GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To neighbors) Go back inside! This is none of your  business! (To ACE.) I don't have to take your shit all  the time anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll to the FBI!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Rothstein, hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will go to the police! I am not (kicking hedge) Protecting you anymore, you fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Ro- Mrs Rothstein! Okay, shh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An FBI AGENT is parked down the block, photographing the  scene through a long-lens camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...let me inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the FBI AGENT and his camera as he photographs the sce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't let me in my own house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein. Mr Rothstein, I'm sorry.  We've got some complaints about -  about the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to get in my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't let me go in my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let her in. I'm sorry, Randy,  I'm not gonna let her in. She - Well,  I'm not gonna let her in, the way  she's behaving. I'm - I'm -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna let me in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows what you're gonna do in  there? I don't want you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what am I gonna  do? I'm in the same clothes for two  days! I want to get a few of my  things! Big deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Rothstein, why don't we just let  her in the house and get a few of  her things?  That way she'll get out  of here. This is half her house  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to let her in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid she's gonna destroy stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Kicking, pulling up  plants and throwing  them at ACE) Let me in the house! Fucker! COP #1 holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I let her in like - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to be afraid, the way you  fuckin' treat me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr Rothstein, it'll make it a  lot easier on everybody here if we  just let her in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we let her get a few of her things  we'll be out of your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she calms down, I will let her in  the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pants, yelling) I am calm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she calms down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To GINGER) No, you're not calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I will let her in the house for  five minutes if you gentlemen will  escort her out if she happens not to  want to leave. Because I don't - I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COP #1) Can I go in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a problem, that's not a p-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, would you go in with her? GINGER walks towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do that. Absolutely. Yes.  Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, fine!  Fine! (In ACE's face as she  brushes past him.) Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI AGENT taking photographs. We see a series of surveillance photos of GINGER, ACE and the COPS on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY is watching her parents and the COPS across the stree until the housekeeper pulls her away into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From following scene) You wouldn't believe how mean he's  been to me. He's locked up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER races up the stairs, trailed by COP #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...most of my important stuff, all  my papers and things. And I have to  get 'em. She walks across the room to ACE's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't let him come in here 'cause  I know they're in here in the desk  and he's - She tries to open the middle drawer but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! (Going through a couple  of drawers.) Just pay attention. He could come up  here at any time. (Pants.) She spots a pair of scissors on the desk. She tries to op the drawer with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Then, to COP #2) Are you watching for him? She finally pries the drawer open, breaking the tip of th scissors.  GINGER's hands open the drawer and she picks u the safe deposit keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got 'em. FREEZE FRAME ON THE GLIMMERING KEYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and COP #1 are on the front porch talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smoking, checking  his watch) Yeah, I don't want her in there more  than a few more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's - it'll just be a couple of  minutes. We got other things to do  too, you know. He'll hurry her up.  How's everything else besides this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine. How's your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, not bad. In fact, uh, my  wife's pregnant again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. ACE shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, yeah... I'm kind of happy  about this, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER runs into the closet, bending down to search throu the shoe boxes that usually contain money but are now emp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Kneeling, to COP #2) I just have to get this one more  thing and then we'll be - We can go. (She picks up an empty  shoe box.) Shit! (Gets up, picking up  a pair of ACE's shoes  and tossing them on  the floor.) God, fuck! Shit! God! (She runs out, taking  a fur coat off a  hangar. Then, grunting) Really pisses me off...  (To COP #2.) Don't worry about it. COP #2 follows her out of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE, COP #1 and several neighbors wait as GINGER storms o with COP #2 carrying a small overnight bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the COPS but  looking at ACE) And it would be great if you guys  could follow me out of here, because  he's been threatening me. GINGER walks to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COP #1) Come on. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to COP #1, shaking  hands) Okay, Randy. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, take care. GINGER backs her car out, smashing into ACE's car once ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERBERT watches from a small, curtained window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER drives down the street followed by the police car. The FBI camper pulls out and follows the squad car follow GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER is driving and crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To herself, panting) I can't believe this. (Sighs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER swerves into the bank, parks in front of the main  entrance and gets out of her car. The COPS park behind he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COPS, rushing  inside) I just need to pick up a little cash  inside.  Could you come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more FBI AGENTS, with binoculars and a camera, photog GINGER as she walks into the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank employee is helping GINGER unlock a safe deposit b She pulls it out hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is on the phone talking to CHARLIE CLARK. He's lookin at the jimmied rawer, broken scissors and the missing key

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone,  throwing the scissors  into the open drawer) Charlie, you've gotta - you've gotta  stop her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) I-I'm sorry, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) You've got to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) She's a fuckin' junkie. She's out of  her fucking mind.  Do you unders- SHERBERT is behind ACE, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) She has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE CLARK is on the phone. GINGER, in the background, comes out of the vault and carries one of her boxes to a  cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) ...the keys, and it's still in both  your names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Carrying the box,  slipping but catching  herself) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) I'm sorry, there's nothing I can do.  I'd like to help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) ...but I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Legally, she can't take that stuff.  Legally, she can't take the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) No, Ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Half of everything is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over telephone) Ace, listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Half - I'm comin' down. (He hangs up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE and SHERBERT get into ACE's damaged car. A metal stri dangling from SHERBERT's door scrapes the pavement as the pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER opens the safe deposit box, which is filled with b stacks of cash. She grabs handfuls in a frenzy, some fall off the counter the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Oh, goddamn it! GINGER gets down on the floor to pick them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Then, to COPS who  are watching) Um, I'm gonna need a bag. If you  could just ask the guy for a big  bag, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To COP #2) Go get a bag, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking up, offering  COP #1 some cash) And here. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, I can't. I can't. I ca- COP #2 exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can, you can. (Sobbing.) You've been so nice to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Taking the money) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP #2 holds open a large canvas bag for GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To GINGER) Like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Struggling with two  handfuls of cash) Yeah, just hold the top open, all  right, and I can - She starts to stuff the money in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI AGENTS photograph GINGER leaving the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER throws the canvas bag into the trunk of her car wh suddenly, she sees ACE's beat-up Cadillac approaching. Sh gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. It's him. (To COPS.) You have to stop him. You have to -  'Cause he said he was going to kill  me. ACE jumps out of his car and runs toward GINGER, SHERBERT follows him out. ACE is intercepted by the COPS who hold him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just - Just stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Ro- Mr Roth- Mr Rothstein, where  you goin' -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, hold on a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. The COPS huddle around ACE and SHERBERT until GINGER's ca pulls out of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' we can do about it. Nothin'  we can do. There's nothin' we can  do. ACE, unable to pursue, watches GINGER speed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, look. You can't stop her for  speeding? I mean, look what the hell  she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talkin' to you right now. GINGER's car disappears into traffic. The FBI car across street follows right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do. She had  the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the account. There's nothing  we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AGENTS are following GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's pull her over at that Citgo  Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Driving) Okay, let's do it. FBI AGENT #1 puts a siren on top of the car's roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER pulls over at a gas station, the FBI car with sire blaring right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A powerless ACE and SHERBERT are still standing in front the bank with the COPS. COP #2 gives ACE a 'sorry' gestur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINGER and the FBI AGENTS are standing by her car. She is distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're - we're placing you under arrest  for -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're placing you under arrest for  aiding and abetting -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through tears) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're placing you under arrest for  aiding and abetting a -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Crying) But I'm just trying to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all the threats and all the  bullshit, it turned out Ginger didn't  tell 'em anything. But by then, the  Feds didn't need her, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) But it was just mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had all the pieces they needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't do anything. The AGENTS escort GINGER to their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve FBI AGENTS with rifles, wearing 'FBI' armbands, ch into the parking lot and rush through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...began to tumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI! We have a warrant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...one after the other... just like  dominoes. Between Piscano complaining  on a wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI AGENTS escort DOMINICK, HARDY, FUSCO and MARINO o of the front of the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between Nicky, Ginger, me and my  license... paradise... we managed to  really fuck it all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a doorbell ring. LITTLE NICKY, now ten years old, see FBI AGENTS approaching the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting up from the  couch) Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Yeah, well, someone's at the fuckin'  door now. Jennifer's cousin opens the door; seven AGENTS storm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI. We have a federal search warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away, I got wind of the pinches  comin' down, so I took off. Who needs  to hang around for that bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To JENNIFER, showing  his badge) My name is Marc Caspar, Special Agent,  FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Defensive) Yeah, well, (grabbing the phone  and walking away) Can I make a fuckin' phone call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Blocking her way as  she tries to get by  him) Hey, ho-hold it for a minute. You  can make a phone call, but you don't  have to talk to us like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Slamming the phone  down on a table) Hey -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCE is talking to a cashier behind the cage when FBI AG with Gaming Board investigators DUPREY and AUSTIN enter t casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI! Don't be alarmed. NANCE rushes out a back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they got almost everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This area is seized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab everything in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Walking through a  door into the cage) Get the master account list!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want all those papers seized,  regardless of what they are. As AUSTIN and the others make their way into the soft cou room, an AGENT puts up a yellow crime banner across the f of the cashier's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this area off-limits to  everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counters look on as several AGENTS seize the money bo and stacks of cash from the glass table. DUPREY sifts thr the Count Room Executive's notebook. AUSTIN is at a cabinet looking through a ledger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Holding the book) Ah, yes, here we are. A little craps  figures.  [Actual amount taken from  craps tables before the skim.] Hey -  Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN, wearing a tennis outfit and holding a racquet, is  being questioned by FBI AGENT #8 who's showing him confis papers. Several AGENTS are searching the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty thousand dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he didn't. And that's why it  wasn't valid. I was being extorted,  all right?  I'm willing to tell you  whatever you want to know. I've got  nothin' to hide here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, for the best...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI AGENT #9 removes some ledgers from a a filing cabinet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I couldn't believe this shit.  Piscano's expense reports took the  cake. AGENTS are wandering around the house, looking for eviden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is good. Bingo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might as well have given them a  fuckin' blueprint.  Everybody's names,  address, dates, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Crossing the room to

dialogues.speaker: PISCANO
dialogues.text: Look at this! That you so much, Mr  Piscano. How considerate of you.  Appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are my m- those are my mother's  books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fuckin' balloon head. PISCANO gets more and more agitated as FBI AGENT #10 gets one cuff on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys doin'?! PISCANO gasps and clutches his chest, having a heart atta The AGENT drops the cuffs and tries to help PISCANO as he collapses onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Artie. We just want to  talk to you. PISCANO'S WIFE and the FBI AGENTS kneel down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Screaming) Artie, are you okay? Sweetheart?  Honey? Wait a minute! He's sick!  Artie! Oh, God! She continues to scream as the AGENTS try to revive him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To PISCANO's wife) Move back! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick! It's his heart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CPR! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, is he breathing? He's not  breathing! An FBI AGENT gives him mouth-to-mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Artie. He got so upset he had a  heart attack and dropped dead right  there in front of his wife. FBI AGENTS #9 and #10 restrain PISCANO'S hysterical WIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down! Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I won't calm down! He's my  husband!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie! Artie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't help him if -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE opens his front door and is confronted by two FBI AGE He is shown pictures of NICKY and GINGER at the construct site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) And at the end of the day, they  finally came to see me with the  pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to the  pictures) Why protect a friend who betrayed  you like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't want to look at 'em. I  didn't want to look at the guys who  brought 'em either. ACE refuses to look at the photos and quietly closes the  door on the AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAGGI, FORLANO, BORELLI and CAPELLI are all in court. FOR and CAPELLI are breathing through masks and oxygen tanks  with nearby doctors and nurses. GAGGI has a cane in front of him. Several court spectators look on. We hear the bosses' lawyer speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, as you can see, my clients  are elderly and infirm. Any  incarceration could pose a serious  health risk. They are no danger to  the community and they pose no flight  risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the bosses were arrested, some  of 'em were so old they needed doctors  at their arraignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Pre-trial Services recommends  that bail remain as presently set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling a recess) We're going to take a ten-minute  recess. The JUDGE pounds his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when it looked like they could  get twenty-five years...  The BOSSES, their nurses and lawyer file through a side c door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to life in prison, just for  skimmin' a casino... sick or no  fuckin' sick, you knew people were  gonna get clipped. So, the day of  the arraignment, they had this meeting  right in the back of the court-house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOSSES are gathered around a conference table as the  lawyers and nurses silently walk out the door as if on cu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, when something like this happens,  you know how things are gonna work  out. It's always better with no  witnesses. So, what about Andy? THE CAMERA PANS FROM ONE BOSS TO THE OTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Putting down his  oxygen mask once the  door behind him is  shut) He won't talk. Stone is a good kid.  Stand-up guy, just like his old man.  That's the way I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. He's solid. A fuckin' Marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Holding his oxygen  mask) He's okay. He always was. Remo, what  do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause) Look... why take a chance? At least,  that's the way I feel about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDY STONE and his LAWYER are walking toward their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call Artie... and you tell him I  don't care what, he's gotta be in my  office Thursday morning before eleven  o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. His LAWYER veers to the left, walking away from STONE who keeps talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To himself) It's terribly important. I gotta  have a conversation with this guy.  That's all. GAGGI's men, CURLY and BEEPER, appear from behind STONE a shoot him dead. They empty their silent half-load rounds into STONE even  after he's down on the snowy ground. They walk away  discreetly, leaving him partially hidden between cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as they liked him, I mean,  he wasn't one of us. He wasn't  Italian. As far as they knew, he  could have talked. Otherwise, Stony  might still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE IN
dialogues.text: The camera moves down a waterfall to reveal NANCE's Spani style house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first one to skip was John Nance.  He found a nice, warm secluded place  in Costa Rica. He thought nobody  would find him there. Several gunshots are heard. NANCE emerges from the house  through a door and runs along a verandah to another door. breaks a pane of glass, unlocks another door and runs in. BEEPER emerges from the first door and follows him back i the house. Several more shots are heard. NANCE emerges fr yet another door, only this time he's been shot in the  stomach. He painfully staggers away from the hitmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, then, his kid got nabbed by the  Feds for drugs, and so naturally the  bosses were afraid he'd come out of  hidin' just to save his kid and give  'em all up.  So... CURLY and BEEPER come out of the house and approach NANCE from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where you goin', jag-off? NANCE kneels down. CURLY points his gun expertly at the t of NANCE's head and fires. Blood splatters from NANCE's m and he falls to the ground. The gunmen walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But anyway, they, you know, they all  had to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bound COUNT ROOM EXEC and a CLERK are kneeling next to large pit in the esert ground in front of BEEPER and CURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody went down. The CLERK groans as he's shot in the head by BEEPER. Bloo splatters and he falls right into the pre-dug hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. CURLY shoots the EXEC in the head, he too falls backward  into the pit. The gunmen fire more rounds into the bodies then toss their guns into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you knew it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE, a sharply dressed Tangiers EXEC, is getting into new Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...anybody who knew anything wound  up gettin' whacked. CURLY sneaks up from behind and hits the EXEC with a lead pipe. He puts a plastic bag over his head and begins to c him to death. The EXEC struggles a bit but the bag soon f with blood. CURLY strikes him with the pipe one last time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans away from an empty registration desk to a motel corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gasping) Oh! Oh, no!  No... The camera moves past several rooms along a cinder block  wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Ginger took off, she wasn't  much help to anybody. She found some  pimps, low-lifes, druggies and bikers  in LA. And in a few months, they  went through all the money and all  the jewels. Suddenly, a door opens and GINGER overdosing, staggers in the hall looking for help. She gasps, goes halfway down t seedy corridor towards the desk, but collapses and dies. FREEZE FRAME ON GINGER SPRAWLED OUT ON THE MOTEL CARPET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they found her body... I had a  private doctor do another autopsy.  He said they gave her... a hot dose.  In the end... all she had left was  thirty-six hundred in mint-condition  coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE emerges from the restaurant, smoking a cigarette as i the first scene in the film. He gets into his car to star the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what the Feds or the papers  might have said about my car  bombing... Flames surge from the windshield, concealing ACE behind t wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign above him reads: 'Tony Roma's a Place for Ribs'. ACE is leaving the restaurant and walking to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it was amateur night, and you  could tell. Whoever it was, they put  the dynamite under the passenger  side. But what they didn't know,  what nobody outside the factory knew,  was that that model car was made  with a metal plate under the driver's  seat. It's the only thing that saved  my life. ACE opens his car door and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE turns on the ignition and we see two- and three-inch  flames come out of the defroster vents. Everything goes s as he is suddenly engulfed in flames. The car explodes in flames two storeys high. The screen f with the rising explosion of smoke and fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bombing was never authorized,  but I suspect I know who lit the  fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY, DOMINICK and MARINO get out of a car on a farm roa for a meeting. FAT SALLY, a heavy-set wiseguy, is already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so did the power that be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mikey, how's your hernia? They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'? MARINO approaches NICKY from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took months for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY's car drives up the farm road to meet his crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...everything to calm down, but  finally my guys got out on bail and  the bosses wanted me to send my  brother Dominick out to Vegas.  Always  the dollars, always the fuckin'... NICKY, DOMINICK and MARINO get out of the car to greet FA SALLY. HARDY, FUSCO and BEEPER are also waiting there,  smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dollars. I mean, it was still way  too hot for me to even go near Vegas,  so I set up a meeting with the guys  way out in the sticks. I didn't want  my brother to get fucked around. NICKY shakes hands with SALLY. FUSCO walks up to say hell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what's right is right. They  don't give a fuck about - urgghh! MARINO hits NICKY in the back with a bat. FAT SALLY grabs him by the throat. HARDY and BEEPER hold DOMINICK by the arms. MARINO hits NICKY's legs with the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Come on, you fuckin' rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!  You... FUSCO and FAT SALLY pin NICKY down and hold his face stra ahead, forcing him to watch his brother being beaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To MARINO) ...rat motherfucker! You rat mother- MARINO hits DOMINICK in the shoulder with the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough guy! You and your f- (he strikes DOMINICK's  chest) Fuckin' brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you - ! NICKY tries to look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him, Marino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hitting DOMINICK  across the neck) You fuckin' scumbag! The wiseguys hold NICKY's face so he has to see his broth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Lunging the bat into  DOMINICK's stomach) No more. He swings the bat across his head, knocking DOMINICK on t ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Still pinned,  screaming) Frankie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking at NICKY as  he strikes DOMINICK) No more! You see? Watch! HARDY and BEEPER join MARINO. All three are beating DOMIN with baseball bats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Held down by his  neck) Frankie! Frankie, you piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you motherfuck! The camera tilts down to DOMINICK's bloody face as the th continue to beat him to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' punk, motherfucker! Piece of  shit! NICKY tries to stand up but FAT SALLY and FUSCO keep him  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more fuckin' dirty work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Rolling over on his  back in pain) No, no, no, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To HARDY and BEEPER) Take him out! Take this motherfucker  out! They drag DOMINICK by his feet. MARINO swings at him with two bats as he's taken away into the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOMINICK is battered and bloody. MARINO, HARDY and BEEPER stand over him, still swinging their bats. NICKY is on his side, still held down by SALLY and FUSCO. His face is a little bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whimpering, as they  beat DOMINICK) Dominick! Oh, Dominick. Oh, Dom. Frankie. (Pleading for his  brother's life.) Frankie, leave the kid alone. He's  still breathin'. He's still breathin'.   Leave him alone. Frankie. MARINO swings two final blows to DOMINICK's head. NICKY l away, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Strip him. MARINO and his hoods remove DOMINICK's pants and shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sobbing as they  undress his brother) No balls, you got no fuckin' balls.  Oh, Dominick. Oh, Dom. NICKY sobs. They drag DOMINICK toward a freshly dug grave and toss his limp, barely conscious body into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Crying quietly) Dominick.  Dominick. (Sobs.) Dominick. NICKY looks up to MARINO. They share a look before MARINO swings his bat, striking NICKY's head. FREEZE FRAME ON MARINO. UNFREEZE - LIVE ACTION CONTINUES. MARINO and his men start beating NICKY, who groans and sp blood as he is struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY is stripped down to his underwear. HARDY and FUSCO  drag him to the grave and dump him over DOMINICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. Bury 'em. MARINO and BEEPER look on as the other hoods begin the te work of tossing dirt on to the bodies, shovel by shovel,  until they are covered up to their necks. We see NICKY's face, bloodied and battered. He's still  breathing and groaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word was out. The bosses had had  enough of Nicky. They had enough.   How much were they gonna take? So,  they made an example of him and his  brother. They buried them while they  were still breathing. A full shovel of dirt lands upon NICKY's face and chest w a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is engulfed in flames. His jacket catches fire. He op the door and rolls out onto the pavement, barely escaping smaller explosion. He lies on the floor as a ball of fire rises behind him. Two men pull him away from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, the -! ACE watches as his car explodes in flames. Ashes and debr fall on ACE and the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Dazed) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had other ideas for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE is being wheeled to an ambulance on a stretcher. Ther are firemen and policemen in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As ACE is wheeled  into the rear of the  ambulance) You sure are lucky, mister. ACE's face disappears into the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACE's car explodes. Music in: J. S. Bach - 'St Matthew Passion'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino is being leveled - actuality footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brand-new 5,000-room hotel with its entrance shaped l the MGM lion's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town will never be the same.  After the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel and casino implodes, filling the screen with fi and smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tangiers, the big corporations  took it all over. Today it looks  like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow motion of tourists walking into a casino looking lik the living dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Disneyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd gathers to watch a mock pirate ship sink in a tan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while the kids play cardboard  pirates, Mommy and Daddy drop the  house payments and Junior's college  money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino is destroyed floor by floor by explosions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on the poker slots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another 5,000 room hotel built like an Arthurian castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the old days, dealers knew your  name, what you drank, what you played.  Today, it's like checkin' into an  airport. And if you order room  service, you're lucky if you get it  by Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino marquee topples to the ground in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, it's all gone. You get a whale  show up with four million in a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living dead walk down a few steps, marveling at the h casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...suitcase, and some twenty-five- year-old hotel school kid is gonna  want his Social Security Number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino collapses into smoke and dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the Teamsters got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 4,000 room hotel with a 60-foot volcano out front. Tour watch it belch smoke and flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...knocked out of the box, the  corporations tore down practically  every one of the old casinos. And  where did the money come from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant glass pyramid 30 stories high with a huge sphinx  outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to rebuild the pyramids?... Junk  bonds.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE IN
dialogues.text: A house very much like ACE's house in Vegas, including th fact that it backs up on a golf course. We see ACE inside talking on the phone with a bookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Still not sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older, grayer ACE is alone in his living-room with TV  sets, fax machines and multiple phone lines. He is surrou by newspapers and files. He is very much the way we saw h during his earlier handicapping days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From a television  set) They're off and running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into telephone) Probable, but may be questionable.  All right. Well, let me know as soon  as you can find out. ACE sets his cordless phone down and jots a few notes on racing form. A television set shows a football game in th background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in the end, I wound up right  back where I started. I could still  pick winners, and I could still make  money for all kinds of people back  home. And why mess up a good thing?  And that's that. He takes off his glasses, and gazes ahead.
